programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Pentecost
programme.sub-title: Pentecost with the Archbishop of Canterbury.
programme.desc: The Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby leads a live service from Holy Trinity Church, Folkestone. Songs and hymns include O Happy Day, How Great Thou Art, and 10,000 Reasons.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott is at Westpoint Exeter, where two teams battle against one another and the clock to find three items to make a profit at auction. Guiding the teams around the antiques fair are experts Philip Serrell and Caroline Hawley.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore properties about to be auctioned, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: City-dwelling families, couples and individuals set out to find their ideal rural retreats with the help of a property expert.(n)

programme.title: Shop Well for Less
programme.desc: The One Show presenter Alex Jones and business journalist Steph McGovern take on a mission to help families change the way they shop without changing their lifestyles. They begin in Glasgow, where Colin and Karen Rodger dream of taking their three sets of twins abroad for the first time. However, they are big spenders, with Karen's shoe addiction rubbing off onto the children, while Colin opts for only the very best when it comes to gadgets. To help them save money, they have their branded products replaced with substitutes, and also test cheaper vacuums and washing detergents. Will they be able to change their spendthrift ways?.(n)

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine presents a selection of viewers' comments on BBC shows, a chance to see memorable clips, and an insight into what goes on behind the scenes of new programmes.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Josie D'Arby presents an episode celebrating the golden jubilee of Liverpool's Metropolitan Cathedral, and meets two of the parishioners. Plus, music to mark the feast of Pentecost.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Ellie Harrison report from Essex, visiting a restored oyster boat, a nature reserve for dragonflies, and a colony of common seals, and meeting people who build racing rowing boats. Steve Brown learns to fire a medieval longbow, Tom Heap reports on environmental damage caused by spoil heaps, and Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith meet a contender for Countryfile's Young Farmer Award.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby presents a Leaders' Special Question Time with Tim Farron of the Liberal Democrats, and First Minister Nicola Sturgeon, leader of the SNP.(n)

programme.title: One Love Manchester Concert
programme.desc: Live coverage of the benefit concert from Old Trafford cricket ground in Manchester, organised to raise money for those affected by last month's Manchester bombing. The stellar line-up includes Ariana Grande, Take That, Katy Perry, Justin Bieber, Coldplay, Pharrell and Usher, with proceeds going to the We Love Manchester emergency fund.(n)

programme.title: Election Questions
programme.desc: Green Party co-leader Jonathan Bartley and UKIP leader Paul Nuttall discuss the key issues of the general election and answer questions from a studio audience. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Election Questions
programme.desc: Leanne Wood, leader of Plaid Cymru, discusses the key issues of the election with a studio audience. Presented by Bethan Rhys Roberts.(n)

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: A look at the biggest issues in the women's game, focusing on matters at both club and international level.(n)

programme.title: Up There
programme.desc: A spirit is given the job of escorting the recently deceased to the afterlife, when all he wants to do is cross over himself. He is partnered with an annoyingly cheerful sidekick for his latest assignment, but they manage to lose the soul in question and face a frantic search through a British seaside town. Comic fantasy, starring Burn Gorman, Kate O'Flynn and Aymen Hamdouchi.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Hospital Bed
programme.desc: New series. More stories of patients at hospitals around the nation, focusing on Queen Elizabeth Hospital Birmingham, Leeds Children's Hospital and Barnsley Hospital.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of a Nottinghamshire house that was in the same family for more than 60 years, a terraced property in East Ham, London, and a former care home in Stoke-on-Trent.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: A shocking expose into food fraud in curry houses, including lab tests that reveal surprising truths about meals that simply are not as described.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A rescue worker comes to the aid of a crashed mountain biker, and a woman misreads road crossing signs and steps out in front of a biker.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin oversees proceedings as Tim Weeks and Richard Madley helps two teams look for items at the South of England Showground in Ardingly, West Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Mrs Tembe proposes she undertake a secret mission for the good of Heston's relationship, while Ayesha encounters a children's entertainer with a strange phobia.(n)

programme.title: !mpossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton heads to Shropshire, where he helps a soon-to-be-wed couple search for a property on a budget of £470,000, and also visits a family-run farm that produces quinoa.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Michelin-starred chef Galton Blackiston puts three home cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including making quail's egg wrapped in a nest of potato. Sheree Murphy hosts.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Kate Bliss v John Cameron Foreign Antiques Market.
programme.desc: Kate Bliss takes on John Cameron at a flea market in Paris, where they must find the best antiques at the lowest prices so they can sell them on to make as much profit as possible back in the UK.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: A party election broadcast by the Labour Party for the general election on Thursday.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones, Matt Baker and a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK.(n)

programme.title: Suzi Perry's Queens of the Road
programme.desc: Documentary in which the presenter attends the Cookstown 100 motorcycle road race, and meets three female competitors. Belfast resident Yvonne Montgomery took up the sport 10 years ago following her divorce, Melissa Kennedy from Co Fermanagh works alongside her father, who maintains her bikes, while Veronika Hankocyova has travelled from Prague and delayed her wedding to compete.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Josh sends Lauren home when she falls ill just before an important presentation, and when Steven tries to comfort her, she finally shares some harsh words with him. Kim worries about Denise's behaviour and has a heart-to-heart with her sister, while Louise grows closer to Travis - prompting Madison and Alexandra to cast doubts in her mind about his real intentions.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Back to the Falklands: Brothers in Arms - Panorama.
programme.desc: The programme explores how the trauma of fighting a war can continue to affect soldiers even decades later, following men who served in the Welsh Guards as they return to the Falkland Islands for the first time since the conflict in 1982 to confront their demons.(n)

programme.title: Doctor in the House
programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Nicola, who has been diagnosed with 10 different conditions, including fibromyalgia, ME, sciatica and depression, and her pain and exhaustion has led her to become reliant on painkillers and struggling to get through the day. The doctor also spends time with Laverne, who is suffering from stress and severe exhaustion and is at risk of developing life-threatening type 2 diabetes. Rangan must find a way to completely overhaul her lifestyle, including her diet, sleeping habits and work-life balance. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins for an extended edition of the current affairs quiz, with Sky News editor-at-large Adam Boulton and broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Tom Cruise, currently promoting new movie The Mummy, along with Annabelle Wallis who appears alongside him in the film. Hollywood heart-throb Zac Efron also takes up residency on the sofa to discuss the big-screen revival of 1990s cult TV series Baywatch. Plus, singer-songwriter Beth Ditto performs her current single Fire. Providing there's time - and there usually is - Graham will also subject more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better stand up to scrutiny.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter O, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton, Danny Clarke and the team transform a Manchester back garden into a time travel-themed space for a Doctor Who fan.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on herbs that will grow happily in shade, and has an unusual choice for his summer containers - bananas. He also recalls a visit he made to Chatsworth House earlier in the year, where he learned about the history of its extensive grounds and gardens and heard of the challenges of putting on its first RHS flower show. Flo Headlam visits a school where gardening is high on the curriculum, while Nick Bailey reveals how a pond can be built in a weekend. Plus, the programme catches up with a head gardener who manages a garden situated on a barge. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: The green-fingered team takes a break from routine duties to attend Gardening Scotland, the biggest horticultural show north of the border. The cream of British growers will be there, with everything from pansies to pelargoniums, and cacti to clematis in a stunning floral frenzy. The presenters meet those who are growing for gold, including the exhibits showing off their medals from last week's Chelsea Flower Show. The programme focuses on the Scottish talent and Scottish plants as it samples the event's unique atmosphere.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: A round-up of reports on spring, including Matt Baker examining the return of tulips to Lincolnshire's farmland and Ellie Harrison investigating an influx of migrating jellyfish in Cornwall. Adam Henson gets the chance to be an auctioneer at Exeter's livestock market, and Steve Brown discovers how one of the wonders of the season can only be appreciated in the dark. Plus, a taste of spring with chef Paul Ainsworth.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Scotland chefs hope to impress with their main dishes. Angela Malik prepares a tiffin box featuring a summer biriyani, quail scotch egg and spiced quail breasts, while Michael Bremner takes a huge risk by using ox tongue as the centrepiece of his main. Ally McGrath devises an inventive take on the summer barbecue, using a new method of cooking potatoes to recreate the coals.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Angela Malik, Ally McGrath and Michael Bremner continue their battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's Scotland final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Scotland chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Gary Parsons - executive chef at Wimbledon - as the programme continues its tennis-themed series.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the popularity of sugar-rich foods in Britain, and try to make their own versions of their favourite childhood sweets. The duo also prepare a cheesecake and a sweet-and-sour dish.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms takes a retrospective look at the television appearances made over the years by Oscar-winning actor Laurence Olivier, using rare material from the BBC archives to capture the highlights and milestones of his life and extraordinarily distinguished career.(n)

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: A couple are keen to find suitable husbands for their five daughters. When a wealthy gentleman and his friend arrive in the area, it leads to an encounter between headstrong daughter Elizabeth and aloof gentleman Mr Darcy, and their instant dislike gradually turns into an unexpected romance. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, starring Laurence Olivier and Greer Garson.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Conservationist Dr Julian Fennessy is on a mission to learn more about the giraffes of Africa, but the most important fact is that they are disappearing. In an urgent attempt to save them, he and a determined Ugandan team round up 20 of the world's rarest giraffes to take across and beyond the mighty Nile River. The stakes are high, but if they succeed the reward will be a brighter future for an animal Dr Fennessy believes has been overlooked. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin meets people hoping to make a profit from their antiques in Derby, where the finds include an elegant station wall clock, a unique collection of razors and an immaculate working toy train set. The presenter also visits the Marmite factory in Burton-upon-Trent, Staffordshire. With experts Philip Serrell and Michael Baggott.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of more than 10,000 people as they race to build Crossrail - a new 73-mile train line linking east and west London, costing £15billion. As they excavate the 26 miles of tunnels, engineers must make sure that listed buildings don't crack, London Underground trains keep running, roads don't have to be shut and the City stays in business. Crucially, they must drive one of their gigantic 1,000-ton tunnel-boring machines through a narrow gap at Tottenham Court Road station without disturbing the passengers on the platforms below.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Evan Davis presents the business ideas contest, as regular panelists Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sarah Willingham and Nick Jenkins assess the profit-making potential of a brand of pork scratchings and a device for folding paper. The entrepreneurs behind a fledgling fashion business also try their luck, but textile tycoon Touker is far from impressed.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A nurse living in Nottingham whose husband is in the army has rarely settled for long in one place and would like to move somewhere with a sense of community. She trades places with a B&B owner from Alaska, who is hoping to escape her small-town life and see more of the world as she approaches retirement.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: Paul spends six days exploring Germany in six different cars. After getting used to German driving on the streets of Berlin, he visits a Cold War checkpoint and a nudist colony, and pits cars made in the 1970s on either side of the Berlin Wall against each other. The trip ends at the Nurburgring racetrack, where he is joined by comedian Al Murray.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: Vincent, Fitzpatrick and Lavender meet a group of men from a local publishing company, raising the alpha male stakes when the trio discover the exciting perks the publishers receive in their line of business, namely company cars. In the showroom, receptionist Carol tries to get to grips with the new office computer. Elsewhere, in a bid to save face, Fitzpatrick puts faith in his comprehensive knowledge of the company Cachet's home turf, with potentially dangerous consequences for everyone concerned.(n)

programme.title: Dara O Briain Crowd Tickler
programme.desc: The Irish comedian performs at the Hammersmith Apollo, as part of his 2015 tour. Not surprisingly, he leads the audience on a rip-roaring journey through expertly crafted routines, cracking one-liners and the lighting-fast spontaneous gag-making that makes him one of the top exponents of the craft on the circuit at the moment.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: India v Pakistan. Action from the latest match of the tournament, which saw the Group B teams face each other at Edgbaston in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: Salvage
programme.desc: A mysterious and deadly creature escapes from a sunken cargo ship and hides out in a suburban neighbourhood. As paranoia grips the populace and the military try to cover things up, a woman desperately searches for her missing daughter - only to come face to face with the monster. Horror, starring Neve McIntosh, Shaun Dooley and Linzey Cocker.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from East Barnet in north London, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: As a personal emergency strikes, Mo makes a heart-wrenching decision, and when Nina oversteps the mark with a patient on AAU, her judgement is called into question. Elsewhere, Essie's teasing of Raf results in a surprising revelation.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A British flying doctor races to the rescue after a family is injured in a major car crash. In the Outback, a UK policewoman arrests a drink driver.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate the new trend for protein-enhanced versions of familiar products to see if paying the extra has any benefit.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: The weekly final sees chefs Nigel Haworth, Amandine Chaignot, Paul Ainsworth and Jun Tanaka pair up with their chosen home cook partners and go head to head in the ultimate pro-am cooking competition. And to pile on the pressure, three-star Michelin chef Pierre Koffmann judges their final dishes. Culinary challenge, hosted by Sheree Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second show from Ightham Mote near Sevenoaks, where finds include a gold ring containing a lock of Lord Byron's hair, a collection of postcards from 1916 that reveal how a British PoW sent messages to his family, and a pair of Chinese paintings that make a big impression on specialist David Battie.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: A 78-year-old man tries to track down a cousin he has not seen for 70 years and a woman employs an agency to help her find her father, who left home before she was born.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Paudge re-evaluates his arrangement with drug dealer Beady Burke, an indecent exposure case takes a mesmerising twist, and Sean puts his dignity on the line.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore Britain's knack for gardening as they continue their culinary journey through time. The duo also look at the country's passion for growing vegetables at home, a skill that has inspired some amazing dishes.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: The lives of orphaned baby elephants and the dedicated keepers who care for them. In the first programme, Michaela Strachan catches up with Lualeni to see if her situation has improved since her mother died, while Jonathan Scott visits Tsavo, where elderly elephant Emily has a surprise for him.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.desc: The course of the seasons, beginning with spring, which sees the hills on fire on fire as the annual muirburn takes place in the Cairngorms. As the flames rise, an osprey returns to a valley near Loch Ness, with its movement captured in super slow-motion at 800 frames per second. Red squirrels and roe deer prepare for the breeding season, while a cataclysmic downpour has major consequences for a family of dippers, whose youngsters are forced to fledge early before the nest is swept away. Narrated by Ewan McGregor.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts James Braxton and Helen Hall set off on a search for potentially lucrative items, beginning in Oswestry, Shropshire, then heading through Montgomery and Machynlleth in Powys, en route to an auction in Carmarthen. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch Unsprung
programme.desc: New series. Chris Packham and Lindsey Chapman return with the companion show to the main programme, which features analysis, news, nature quizzes, debates and photos and videos sent in by viewers. They are joined by guests Sue Perkins and Kate Humble, who discuss the use of dogs in conservation, and there is a report from Craig Revel Horwood on the dawn chorus.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Transylvania to the Black Sea - Part One.
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures east through Romania, encountering a bloodsucking vampire in Transylvania and brown bears in the Carpathian forest, before visiting a fairytale castle with modern conveniences in Sinaia.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Wales prepare starters, with returning chef Phil Carmichael taking on newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie. The three chefs all create complex dishes, with both Paul and Phil championing the tomato, while Nick hopes his rabbit and carrot dish will give him the edge over the other two.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: In their second week at their base in the National Trust's Sherborne Park estate in Gloucestershire, Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke catch up on all the wildlife action that has taken place over the weekend. Plus, a report by Martin Hughes-Games from the northern tip of mainland UK about a colony of puffins, explaining what can be done do to help this iconic seabird.(n)

programme.title: Cosby: Fall of an American Icon
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of how US comedy giant and African-American role model Bill Cosby finally came to face a criminal trial for sexual assault a decade after the accusations were made, with proceedings set to start in Pennsylvania today. The film explores why it took so long for allegations that he was privately drugging and raping women with impunity to be taken seriously, with accusations from numerous women having fallen on deaf ears for years, and hears from journalists, co-stars and alleged victims.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Terry announces he is standing down as leader of the Danebury Metal Detecting Club, prompting the other members to vie for the position. Meanwhile, Andy and Lance fall out over gold, and Becky and Sophie are forced to become partners in a pub quiz. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook, Gerard Horan and Toby Jones.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur in reaction to the day's events. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Syria - Football on the Front Line
programme.desc: Richard Conway spends time with Syria's national football team during World Cup qualifying and discovers that for some Syrians it manages to transcend the nation's deep divisions.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: Paul spends six days exploring Germany in six different cars. After getting used to German driving on the streets of Berlin, he visits a Cold War checkpoint and a nudist colony, and pits cars made in the 1970s on either side of the Berlin Wall against each other. The trip ends at the Nurburgring racetrack, where he is joined by comedian Al Murray.(n)

programme.title: Egypt's Lost Queens
programme.desc: Professor Joann Fletcher explores what it was like to be a woman of power in ancient Egypt, examining four of the civilisation's most powerful female rulers through a wealth of spectacular buildings, personal artefacts and amazing tombs. As well as the women who held the title of pharaoh, many others played key roles in running the state and shaping every aspect of life.(n)

programme.title: Egypt's Lost Cities
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell and Liz Bonnin join Dr Sarah Parcak on a journey to Egypt to find out whether cities, temples and pyramids are lying beneath the sands. The potential existence of the buildings was suggested by satellites as part of an alternative approach to archaeology.(n)

programme.title: Egyptian Journeys with Dan Cruickshank
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank travels to the desolate ruins of Amarna in search of the truth about Akhenaten, the most radical pharaoh ever to rule Egypt. He converted the nation to his own religion and built a sacred city in the desert where he lived with his wife Nefertiti until their dreams ended in tragedy.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.sub-title: Arena: American Epic: Out of the Many the One.
programme.desc: A look at Hawaiian influences on US roots music, including the invention of the steel guitar by Joseph Kekuku, and the development of Cajun music in Louisiana. Plus, the story of one of the genre's unsung heroes, Mississippi John Hurt, who became a star in the 1920s, only to return to life as a share cropper in the Great Depression, before a revival of his music in the 1960s.(n)

programme.title: Southern Rock at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by classic Southern rock acts on shows including The Old Grey Whistle Test, In Concert and Wogan. Featuring Lynyrd Skynyrd, the Charlie Daniels Band, the Ozark Mountain Daredevils, Delaney & Bonnie with Eric Clapton, Dickey Betts, formerly of the Allman Brothers Band, the Marshall Tucker Band, Black Oak Arkansas, Greg Allman with Cher, and Edgar Winter.(n)

programme.title: Later - with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The maestro introduces a diverse mix of musical performances from the American folk, blues, bluegrass and country scenes. Featuring artists including Plant & Krauss, Carolina Chocolate Drops, Odetta, Emmylou Harris, Norah Jones, Buddy Guy and Johnny Cash.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: Bridging the Gap - How the Severn Bridge Was Built.
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin marks the 50th anniversary of the construction of the Severn Bridge in a Timeshift special telling the inside story of its design and construction. As the motorway link between England and Wales, the Severn Bridge was described as `the most perfect suspension bridge in the world', and Liz reveals how its unique, slim-line structure came about by accident.(n)

programme.title: Engineering Giants
programme.desc: Tom Wrigglesworth and Rob Bell follow each step of the process as a gas installation is pulled from the North Sea by floating cranes, then taken to Newcastle to be disassembled and recycled. They learn how the components of the platform contribute to the process of gas extraction, and talk to engineers about the emotional impact of working on such a remote facility.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Queen of Tigers: Natural World Special.
programme.desc: Machli is one of the world's most famous tigers - the star of five films, with her own Facebook page and more than a million YouTube hits of her attacking a crocodile. Wildlife cameraman Colin Stafford-Johnson returns to India to find his old friend in this documentary charting the extraordinary milestones in Machli's life as a mother and a hunter.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels on London's first railway and admires the remarkable brick viaduct on which it was built, before taking a tour underneath its arches with a Victorian map showing the poverty of those who once lived there. The Docklands Light Railway takes him to Greenwich, home to the tea clipper Cutty Sark, before he ends this leg of his journey in West Silvertown.(n)

programme.title: The Fairytale Castles of King Ludwig II with Dan Cruickshank
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the aesthetic styles associated with Ludwig II of Bavaria, the king who was considered to be handsome and loved by his people. Dan Cruickshank investigates the mock-medievalism of Neuschwanstein castle and the complex design of Herrenchiemsee, to assess how they are key to learning more about the enigmatic ruler.(n)

programme.title: The Medici: Makers of Modern Art
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon examines how the Medici, a family of shadowy, corrupt businessmen driven by greed and ambition, transformed Florence through sculpture, painting and architecture and helped create a world where masterpieces fetch millions today.(n)

programme.title: Francesco's Italy Top to Toe
programme.desc: Francesco da Mosto visits Rome, the hilltop town of Tivoli and Naples, where he explores the city's subterranean tunnels and dodges its notoriously dangerous local motorists. He also stops off at the Galleria Borghese, and the water gardens at Villa d'Este, before meeting a family whose members live near the steaming sulphur jets of Solfatara.(n)

programme.title: Mothers, Murderers and Mistresses: Empresses of Ancient Rome
programme.desc: Professor Catharine Edwards explores the stories of women across centuries that saw the Roman Empire transformed, including the slave-turned-imperial consort Caenis, the empress Julia Domna, and Helena - mother of Emperor Constantine. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 418. Kevin O'Leary offers to give an entrepreneur $1 million; six kid inventors present a device that could help save lives; a woman provides a taste of her s'mores-inspired mini-muffin recipe; two brothers from Austin have an interesting idea for a sushi restaurant; and a New Yorker talks up her online-therapy business. Also: an update on a Season 3 cargo-management system that didn't get any backing from the Sharks(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 515. A former NFL player from Anthem, Ariz., pitches his idea for a mobile fitness company for kids; and the Sharks meet a self-described "wall doctor" from Chester County, Pa. Also: an affordable solution to the problem of too many smartphone photos; an idea for making webcams safer; and an update on Nuts 'N More from Season 4(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 621. A cattleman from Peoria, Ill., returns to show the Sharks what he has learned about the gourmet meat business since he first appeared on the show during Season 4. Also: a lingerie line that's sewn by women in need; and an update on Barbara Corcoran's Season 6 investment in Pipcorn(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 717. Included: a 16-year-old environmentalist from Melbourne, Fla., has an eco-friendly way to dispose of plastic bottles; a former soap-opera villainess from Sherman Oaks, Cal., shows off her stylish and sun-safe one-piece swimsuit; business partners from Washington, D.C., pitch their app, which creates exercise playlists for the everyday person; and a man from Cornith, Texas, reveals what potentially could be hiding in the Sharks' mattresses. Also: a follow-up on Signal Vault from Season 7(n)

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: Tommy sits in on a class and discovers Dick is not a very good teacher, while Sally decides Don is destined for greatness - and resolves to help him achieve it. Comedy, starring John Lithgow, Jane Curtin, Kristen Johnston and French Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The Barones watch Geoffrey having trouble getting the hang of a game, but Ray learns the hard way that his son's lack of ability should not interfere with his enjoyment.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra's divorced parents join the Barones for Thanksgiving - but her father puts a damper on the festivities by bringing a date. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton, Brad Garrett and Doris Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert encounters a beautiful woman who learns his surname is Barone and mistakenly assumes he is Raymond - a situation he is quick to turn to his romantic advantage. Brad Garrett stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Show Where Woody Shows Up.
programme.desc: Woody pays Frasier a surprise visit and the friends become nostalgic about old times in a certain Boston bar. With a guest appearance by Woody Harrelson.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: An episode consisting of three Valentine's Day stories. Frasier takes his station manager to dinner, but cannot work out whether she has a personal or professional interest in him. Niles' plans for a romantic evening are dashed, while Martin and Daphne commiserate with each other in their loneliness. Guest starring Virginia Madsen (Sideways).(n)

programme.title: Eating Well with Hemsley + Hemsley
programme.desc: Jasmine and Melissa Hemsley source grass-fed meat for a protein-rich onglet steak, served with a kale salad and followed by tahini date fridge fudge.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by guests Dan Aykroyd, Claire Goose, Ewen Bremner and Tim Westwood. With music from JP Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Eat the Week
programme.desc: Simon Rimmer offers advice on using spices, providing recipes for duck, baba ganoush, chocolate cake and scallop ceviche, and encourages a fussy youngster to eat his greens.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart disobeys Marge's wishes and attends a rap concert, where he ends up performing with the stars on stage. While returning home, he realises how much trouble he will be in - so he decides to fake his own kidnapping, leading to the arrest of Milhouse's dad. With the guest voice of 50 Cent.(n)

programme.title: The Tigger Movie
programme.desc: Tigger realises being the only one of his kind makes for a lonely life, so he sets off on a bold quest to find more creatures just like him, with the help of his woodland friends. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Jim Cummings, Nikita Hopkins, Ken Sansom, John Fiedler, Tom Attenborough and Peter Cullen.(n)

programme.title: Winnie-the-Pooh: The Most Famous Bear in the World
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh celebrates the 90th anniversary of the creation of the Winnie-the-Pooh stories, which were originally written by AA Milne for his only child Christopher Robin, who featured as a character in the tales. On their first appearance, Milne's stories and poems featuring Pooh Bear became a publishing sensation, and Alan heads to Cotchford Farm in Sussex, where Milne created Pooh, to find out why they were capable of capturing the imaginations of millions. He also takes in the wild woodland that formed the basis for the Hundred Acre Wood, and visits Harrods toy department, where Milne first bought the toys that would later become the inspiration behind the likes of Pooh himself, along with his friends Piglet, Eeyore, Tigger, Kanga and Roo. Includes interviews with Milne's biographer Ann Thwaite, social historian Hester Barron, journalist Matthew Sweet, and children's author Brian Sibley.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Farzana Kausar from Stockport to find a home in Torrevieja on Spain's Costa Blanca that will be accessible for her daughter Aisha's wheelchair.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: New series. Architectural designer Charlie Luxton visits a modern thatched home shaped like a giant letter S on the island of Lewis and Harris in north-west Scotland. Previously seen on More4.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Architect Patrick Bradley has come up with an unusual £100,000 house design built out of four 45ft shipping containers, welded together to form a giant cross and cantilevered over the top of a stream on the family farm in Co Derry. His mother is hoping the new home will help her son find a girlfriend, but the small budget and tight schedule soon pose problems. Kevin McCloud follows his progress.(n)

programme.title: Cabins in the Wild with Dick Strawbridge
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge and Will Hardie take a look at a cabin inspired by the legend of King Arthur and a low-tech double-decker tepee. They also travel further afield in search of inspiration for their own projects, visiting a sea fort in the English Channel and a romantic retreat in Sussex.(n)

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: Offred and her fellow handmaids are called on to assist as Janine prepares to give birth on behalf of her owners. The experience brings back upsetting memories, as she looks back on having a baby of her own in the years before the despotic Gilead regime came to power. Offred develops a closer relationship with Ofglen, but fears for her future when she is summoned to a secret meeting with the Commander. Second episode of the drama based on Margaret Atwood's dystopian novel, starring Elisabeth Moss.(n)

programme.title: The Fake News Show
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan hosts the comedy panel show, with team captains Katherine Ryan and Richard Osman joined by guest captain Richard Ayoade, Rhod Gilbert, Gogglebox's Steph and Dom Parker, and political scientist Professor John Curtice to determine the truth being hidden by fake news, dissecting outlandish headlines, alternative facts, digitally altered photographs and all-too-believable viral clips.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring The Spy Who Loved Me, Andrew Neil with Jeremy Corbyn, the SNP's Manifesto, Paul Hollywood's Continental Road Trip, the Green Party and SNP's Party Election Broadcasts, Your Face or Mine, Great British Skinny Dip and the News.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Out Out Tour
programme.desc: A performance by the comedian from his sold-out nationwide tour. He tells the story of his upbringing in London's East End and his rise to fame, making observations about the British class system along the way.(n)

programme.title: Apocalypto
programme.desc: A Mayan tribesman is captured by enemy warriors and taken to their city to be offered as a human sacrifice. However, he makes a desperate escape and plunges into the jungle in a fraught bid to free his pregnant wife and children from an underground cave. Meanwhile, his captors pursue him and there are omens of impending doom all around. Mel Gibson's historical adventure, with Rudy Youngblood and Dalia Hernandez. In Yucatec Maya.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he heads for West Babylon, New York, where he helped the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts, before returning to Davide in Boston, an Italian restaurant run by two warring brothers. Finally, he visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island, run by hot-headed owner Abby.(n)

programme.title: KOTV Boxing Weekly
programme.desc: Ricky Burns v Julius Indongo. Action from the bout for the WBA and IBF World Super-Lightweight title, which took place at the SSE Hydro in Glasgow. Plus, news and archive fights.(n)

programme.title: Gillette World Sport
programme.desc: Paul Rabil of the New York Lizards gives a lacrosse masterclass, plus action from the latest round of the World Superbike Championship at Donington Park.(n)

programme.title: Mobil 1 The Grid
programme.desc: Neel Jani relives the final laps of the 2016 24 Hours of Le Mans race, and three-time champion Marcel Fassler talks about his move to Corvette following Audi's departure.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to north-west England, where Richard and Helen Francis have been experiencing the city-centre lifestyle in Manchester. However, with a baby on the way, they are looking to move to the suburbs on a budget of £400,000. In Preston, Graham and Nina Walker hope to swap their tiny rented terraced house for their first marital home.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Dan Walker swaps the BBC Breakfast sofa for Dictionary Corner as he joins Nick Hewer, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent for the words-and-numbers game.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Alice Doesn't Lisp Here Any More.
programme.desc: Jack is nominated for an award and Grace is racked with feelings of guilt while attending the funeral of a schoolmate she used to tease for having a lisp. American sitcom, starring Sean Hayes and Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: Last of the Really Odd Lovers.
programme.desc: Jack receives unwanted attention from besotted fan Val, while Will and Grace keep their unsuitable dates a secret from each other. Woody Harrelson guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank catches a football at a college game and refuses to give it back. He tries instead to auction it over the radio for $10,000 - much to the horror of Ray, who tries to make him feel guilty for being so mercenary.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie receives a letter in which a relative boasts about how well her children are doing, and responds by enlisting Debra's help to concoct a fictitious catalogue of her own family's achievements. Doris Roberts and Ray Romano star.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles hires a new lawyer to represent him in his divorce case when Maris tries to postpone the settlement. However, the attorney warns him that his unrequited passion for Daphne could harm his chances in court - and so could Frasier's inability to lie.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles plans a holiday at his newly acquired cabin to get over the shock of Daphne's blossoming romance with Donny, and later joins forces with a lovelorn Roz to end the couple's relationship. Comedy, with David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Crane brothers plan a dinner party, but agonise over who to invite, and devise an unusual game to determine the final guest list. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Wilkinsburg in Pennsylvania, home to Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine, which was opened by retired special-education teacher Jean Gould. During the chef's attempt to save the business from disaster, he discovers her soul-food restaurant resembles a dentist's waiting room and finds a lot of tension between Jean and her employees, who claim she is a Jekyll-and-Hyde character.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jerry and Christine Steele's love of South Africa began decades ago and they have decided to spend part of their retirement in a second home among the beaches and national parks of the Garden Route stretch of the south-eastern coast. For their budget of £60,000, Laura Hamilton shows them five great value properties.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Contestants from in and around Edinburgh vie to host the best dinner party, beginning with competitive couple Michelle and Cameron, who deliver a Spanish-themed first meal. The second day throws up some tuba playing and extreme wine reactions at the home of bad joker Lindsay and his fiancee Tara. Last to host are Lehandra and Joe, who have only been dating for five months and have never thrown a dinner party before.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan considers an Olympic football signed by the Team GB women and a 200-year-old picture with a royal connection. A monster sound system attracts the team in Brighton.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host the words-and-numbers game, with Jimmy Osmond joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the general knowledge quiz in which 15 contestants try to win a place in the end-of-series final, when a £40,000 jackpot will be up for grabs.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: A couple want to retire to Suffolk so they can still be in easy reach of their families, so Kirsty Duffy and David Bull offer them the choices of both rural and seaside properties.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Chimneys B&B in Holbrook, Suffolk, where owner Carolyn Spilling hopes her upbeat personality will be a hit with the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Taxi firm owner Rob hosts the first of a week of dinner parties from in and around Liverpool, hoping his Scouse-themed evening will impress his guests and win him the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A corporation buys Springfield Elementary School so it can secretly use the pupils as guinea pigs to test a new range of toys - but Lisa is not fooled and sets out to stop the businessmen. With the guest voices of Tim Robbins, Joe Mantegna and Gary Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Grace and Warren end up in a tricky situation when two armed thugs handcuff them to a pipe in the office of The Loft. Meanwhile, Darcy is still playing games with Jesse, and Esther spots a hooded figure watching her and gives chase.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: An election broadcast by one of the political parties.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt are joined by guest presenter Kiran Jethwa to investigate the latest dietary trends and scientific advances in the world of weight loss. In Los Angeles, Kate looks into reports that caffeine could be a powerful weapon in the battle of the bulge, while Jimmy heads to Belgium on the trail of chocolate that is packed with bacteria that are supposed to keep people healthy.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: New series. Return of the documentary that follows the work of Bedfordshire Police around the clock as they investigate a number of major crimes. In the first edition, a man emerges from a hotel lift covered in blood and holding a fire extinguisher, before approaching the reception desk and shouting that he has killed someone. Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene.(n)

programme.title: Loaded
programme.desc: In a bid to get the friends to focus on the new game, Leon takes them away for a trip on his new luxury yacht, where Ewan falls for the chef and Josh discovers his host has paid someone to compile a dossier on Abi. The vessel ends up run aground, but Watto finds inspiration via an encounter with a Chinese fisherman. Comedy drama, starring Nick Helm and Jim Howick.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan teaming up against Noel Fielding and Fay Ripley. programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.desc: Documentary about Thames Valley Police's investigation into the disappearance of 31-year-old mother of three Natalie Hemming on May 1, 2016. The programme has extraordinary access to the officers as they try to work out whether Natalie is alive or dead, and to her family and friends, struggling with the situation unfolding around them, before an arrest is made and the case reaches its heartbreaking conclusion.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet makes waves as he drives an unusual tractor.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Oscar the orangutan does not like his elongated arms, and no amount of flattery from Gertie the giraffe seems to change his mind - until his long arms prove vital to a rescue.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Alex the mild-mannered giant suddenly turns up in Adventure Bay, and it is up to Ryder and the pups find a way to keep him busy and avoid more accidental damage to the town.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
