programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe embark on the second day of their culinary road trip. They reach Trawden in Lancashire and pull up beside the ruins of Wycoller Hall with one of their prize cheesecakes to compete in a garden show against some of the best local bakers. Along the way, they catch up with butcher Joseph Mellin to sample a delicacy.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe travel to Kirkby Lonsdale, Cumbria, where they enter the `dessert in a wine glass' category at the Lunesdale Country Show. They also meet gamekeeper Richard Wolfenden, who attends to the red grouse on Fourstones Moor, and he provides them with the luxury ingredient of freshly caught game.(n)

programme.title: Patricia Heaton Parties
programme.desc: Patricia Heaton is bringing the taste of Spain right into her kitchen, demonstrating how to create delicious tapas treats.(n)

programme.title: Patricia Heaton Parties
programme.desc: Comedians Chris Kattan and Molly Shannon join Patricia for a camp-inspired party where she cooks up a chili complete with a toppings bar, along with foil packet corn.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Celebrity chef Jamie Oliver uses wild mushrooms picked in his local forest to rustle up simple dishes including risotto, bruschetta and a venison and funghi stroganoff. His mentor Gennaro Contaldo explains the dangers of some varieties, before sampling the recipes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver joins a partridge shoot, finding out from a gamekeeper how to get involved with the countryside. He then rustles up dishes using fresh game birds and recipes inspired by Asian, European and traditional British cuisine, designed to get the best flavour possible.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul visits San Francisco, home to one of America's most iconic bakes, the sourdough, where he creates savoury bread and butter pudding, and cheese and olive bread.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It's dinner for two with Ree and her husband, Ladd. They whip up fried shrimp with cocktail sauce, spicy curly fries, grilled corn casserole and Mexican chocolate sundaes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe travel to Eden Valley in Cumbria to prepare the perfect sausage roll for the Brough Annual Agricultural Show. They also meet up with Dianne Halliday from the Country Fare Bakery, where a 12-strong team produces thousands of cakes that are sold nationally and internationally.(n)

programme.title: Country Show Cook Off
programme.desc: Aldo Zilli and Silvena Rowe conclude their culinary road trip in the village of Muker in the Yorkshire Dales, where they try to impress judge Val Punchard by being creative with two items from a Dales kitchen. During their visit they meet a couple who are renowned as one of the community's finest food producers and are hoping to impress with a whisky and ginger wine cake.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: A new group of ambitious junior chefs enter the kitchen with hopes of winning over a panel of judges.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul explores an area previously unknown to him, Norwegian baking. He meets a family who bake national treats and creates his version of two of Bergen's favourite bakes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef looks for things to do with pumpkins other than turning them into traditional Halloween lanterns. Recipes include a roast duck and pumpkin winter salad with Asian dressing, a soup and a lighter snack - squash fairy cakes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves up home-grown winter salad dishes, including a bagna cauda, a herb omelette, and a Japanese-style tuna sashimi with sprouting herb salad and a surprising dressing. Meanwhile, gardener Brian experiments with seeds to demonstrate the full array of colourful, tasty ingredients available in the cold, dark months.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a burger joint in Chicago serving umami dishes that prides itself on its Asian flair.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits an authentic Cuban restaurant in Chicago that serves family recipes like the fricassee de pollo.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels around Europe and north Africa to experience local cultures through their cuisine, beginning in Marrakech, where he tries street food, visits a communal bread oven, makes a nomad stew and joins a family for lunch to sample Moroccan home cooking.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine and his team are at a complete loss as to which disaster to address first at the Spunky Monkey Bar and Grill in Auburn, Washington: the health code violations, the subpar food, or the design roadblocks or the lackluster staff.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of a Las Vegas restaurant suspects his wine sommelier is somehow negatively affecting spirit sales.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A restaurant manager contacts the team for help after noticing unusually low sales during a late shift.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor takes up life drawing classes and Margaret is only too happy to see the back of him - until she learns the subject is a nude woman whom he has volunteered to drive home. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney make a bit of cash on a used-car deal and decide to celebrate in style with a night out in the West End. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets his hands on a statue of a Hindu god - which plunges him into the middle of an age-old feud between rival families. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: One of Del's old flames turns up out of the blue, so Rodney and Grandad resolve to extinguish any passion that might still be smouldering in the Peckham wide boy's heart. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy acquires three tons of lead sheeting, which turns out to be a DIY nuclear fallout shelter, so he, Rodney and Grandad collect their sleeping bags and food and have a practice run to make sure they will know what to do if the Russians attack.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: After lending assistance to a wealthy woman in distress, Del seizes a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to improve his social standing by launching his own chandelier-cleaning business. As part of the venture, he ropes a reluctant Rodney and Grandad into helping him. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del jumps at the opportunity to decorate the local Chinese restaurant to make a quick profit, and the results are outstanding in more ways than one. Comedy, with David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del-Boy cannot believe his ears when Rodney tells him he has found a girlfriend. The trouble is, the woman is old enough to be his mother - and to make matters worse, her husband is about to be released from prison.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del encounters an old flame from almost 20 years previously, and Rodney experiences the joys of dating - but the brothers soon face awkward questions from the past. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Diane Langton (The Rag Trade).(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del takes up cards in his latest bid to make his first million - much to the annoyance of Rodney and Grandad, who reckon he will end up gambling away all their worldly goods. programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del gets the chance to sell off a couple of antique urns - the only problem being that one of them contains the ashes of Trigger's late grandfather. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Lennard Pearce and Roger Lloyd Pack.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney mourn Grandad's death, and feel gratified to see such a good turn-out of friends and relatives at his funeral - even if most people are more interested in the food afterwards. programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: Steve and Rob visit the world-famous Malham limestone pavement and eat at the Yorke Arms, as they continue their culinary tour of the north of England, reviewing restaurants for a Sunday newspaper. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: The duo visit Bolton Abbey and eat breakfast at the Angel Inn at Hetton in North Yorkshire. On the journey back to London from their culinary tour of the north of England, they stop off at Steve's parents' house. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Poor sales see Alan's book, Bouncing Back, scheduled to be pulped. However, he is somewhat consoled by his new house being finally completed. After offending a guest on a religious radio programme, he manages to upset other religiously minded guests at Lynn's baptism ceremony. Steve Coogan stars.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It

However, breaking news changes the whole agenda, ruining both PR teams' well-made plans, and as the airwaves are opened up to listeners, spin doctors converge on the studios. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam (Ashes to Ashes).(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: With the prime minister away at a summit in Spain, the media starts to consider Nicola as a potential challenger for the party leadership. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Peter Capaldi.(n)

programme.title: The League of Gentlemen

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers head for Wales, where they meet three women who demonstrate their most impressive dishes, preparing Maltese stuffed marrow, an elaborate cheesecake, and an orchid gateaux. The pair also enjoy biker-cooked lamb cutlets en croute with a red wine gravy, and visit a recipe fair where budding cooks gather to share the best meals on their family menus.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great British Bake Off Masterclass.
programme.desc: Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood tackle the signature, technical and showstopper challenges from the second half of the series. Mary makes a swirling chocolate and orange tart, a Swedish princess torte and her own version of the two-tiered dobos torte, while Paul prepares mini sausage plaits and demystifies the kouign amann, which baffled the bakers in the tent.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: It's the last week of the heats and five more chefs enter the kitchen, with the first challenge giving them an hour to cook a signature dish that showcases what they can do, before one is asked to leave. The remaining four contenders try to impress Monica Galetti by preparing a cuttlefish dish in just 15 minutes, and then Marcus Wareing gives them 60 minutes to create a meal incorporating sweetbreads. The judges then decide which three will make it through to the next round.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers demonstrate how to make gourmet food without breaking the bank. They begin with a few weekend treats, rustling up several delicious dishes, gleaning money-saving secrets at the UK's only pub with two Michelin stars and finding out how beer can be as good a match with food as wine. Everything they learn will be put to the test when they help a wounded soldier say thank you to some very important people with a surprise barbecue.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef takes a gastronomic road trip to Istanbul through the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a melting pot of East and West. His journey begins in the city of Venice, and on the idyllic Greek island of Symi he cooks some of his favourite Venetian dishes including seafood risotto, tiramisu and gnocchi with spider crab.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and greengrocer Chris Bavin set out to help the Scott-Dent family in Newport with their food shopping, showing them simple and effective ways to save money. Kate and Chris have three children under 10, they both work, and Kate hates cooking, so relies on freezer food, Gregg and Chris secretly watch them on a weekly shop to see where they are going wrong, and their mistakes include buying sliced and grated cheese, pre-prepared fruit and veg, and overpriced frozen food. The couple are shocked when they are told that they are spending twice the amount of an average family of five. Plus, Chris tries to allay Kate's fear of using food near its sell-by date, and investigates how safe our food labels really are, while dietician Lucy Jones investigates the nutritional differences between margarine and butter.(n)

programme.desc: Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she tries to spice up her own marriage and deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: Speed Racer
programme.desc: A young race-car driver discovers that the world of auto racing is fixed in this live-action adaptation of the seminal Japanese anime. With the help of his family, he competes in a cross-country rally in order to expose those responsible(n)

programme.title: The Winning Season
programme.desc: In this touching comedy-drama, an alcoholic named Bill (Sam Rockwell) seeks redemption by coaching his daughter's high-school basketball team after his drinking problem squandered a career in the NBA. Directed by James C. Strouse(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Years after the events of The Bourne Ultimatum, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) resurfaces just as his former employers are implementing a new program aimed at hunting him down. Now fully recovered from his amnesia, Bourne teams up with Nicky Parsons (Julia Stiles) to uncover the truth behind his father's death, while simultaneously exacting revenge and evading the government forces hot on his trail. Paul Greengrass returns to helm this sequel, which co-stars Tommy Lee Jones, Alicia Vikander, Riz Ahmed, and Vincent Cassel(n)
A look at the June 17 light-heavyweight rematch between Andre Ward and Sergey Kovalev in Las Vegas(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: The Book of Kevin. Season 3 begins three years after the Guilty Remnant descended on Miracle, Texas, where Kevin is now chief of police, a job that isn't made any easier by the fact that the seventh anniversary of the Sudden Departure is two weeks away, and many citizens are convinced that another apocalyptic event is in the offing(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Don't Be Ridiculous. Nora goes to St. Louis on business for the Department of Sudden Departure to investigate a possible scam that involves convincing family members of The Departed that they can see their loved ones again(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Crazy Whitefella Thinking. As the Departure anniversary approaches, Kevin Garvey Sr. is inspired to wander the Australian outback in an effort to save the world from apocalypse(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: G'Day Melbourne. Kevin and Nora take a trip to Australia, where she continues to follow the masterminds of an elaborate con, while he is surprised by a face from the past that takes him back to the traumatic events from three years ago(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.sub-title: It's a Matt, Matt, Matt, Matt World
programme.desc: It's a Matt, Matt, Matt, Matt World. Matt heads to Australia to bring Kevin home when he's convinced he should be in Miracle for the seventh anniversary of the Departure(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.desc: Certified. Laurie dons her therapist cap once again to help Nora and Kevin along their paths in Australia(n)

programme.title: The Leftovers
programme.sub-title: The Most Powerful Man in the World (and His Identical Twin Brother)
programme.desc: The Most Powerful Man in the World (and His Identical Twin Brother). Kevin's mission of mercy finds him assuming an alternate identity(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Hugely successful businesswoman Michelle Darnell (Melissa McCarthy) is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she is forced to move in with a long-suffering employee of hers (Kristen Bell), and tries to earn redemption and revamp her public image by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies. Peter Dinklage, Kristen Schaal, and Kathy Bates co-star in this comedy, which was directed by Ben Falcone (McCarthy's real-life husband), and co-written by McCarthy, Falcone, and Steve Mallory(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: An unemployed young man avoids his father and a bully while trying to help his best friend pay back a debt to a drug dealer(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Former Saturday Night Live "Weekend Update" co-anchors Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this baby-fever comedy about a single, career-oriented woman who previously put parenthood on hold, and is forced to hire a surrogate mother when she discovers there is only a one-in-a-million chance that she will be able to get pregnant. Kate Holbrook (Fey) is a 37-year-old business executive who has always put her professional life before her personal life, but these days her biological clock is ticking louder than ever before. As with everything else she has accomplished in life, Kate is determined to have a child on her own terms. Unfortunately for Kate, the chance of her ever becoming pregnant is slim to none. Undaunted, a willful Kate drafts South Philly working-class girl Angie Ostrowiski (Poehler) -- a woman who may just be her polar opposite -- to be a surrogate mother. Subsequently informed by the head of the surrogacy center (Sigourney Weaver) that her surrogate is indeed pregnant, the excited mother-to-be soon purchases every child-rearing book she can find and excitedly begins the nesting process. But life hasn't quit throwing Kate curveballs just yet, because when a pregnant Angie shows up on her doorstep with no place to live, the woman who once thrived on order finds her life descending into chaos. Now, as Kate attempts to transform Angie into the ideal expectant mother, this odd couple will discover that families aren't always biological, but occasionally formed through friendship as well. Writer Michael McCullers, who authored the screenplays for Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me and Undercover Brother in addition to working on Saturday Night Live, makes his feature directorial debut with a self-penned screenplay(n)

programme.title: Cloud Atlas
programme.desc: This epic comprises six tales from various historical eras. An 18th-century notary goes on a sea voyage; a musician becomes an apprentice to a famous composer in 1930s Belgium; a journalist uncovers corruption at a nuclear power plant in '70s California; a contemporary publisher seeks refuge from gangsters at a nursing home; a clone escapes her job at a fast-food establishment in futuristic Korea; a tribesman struggles to survive in a postapocalyptic wasteland(n)

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jackie Chan is a perfect fit in this stylish comedy-adventure about a cabbie-turned-chauffeur who fills in for his out-of-commission secret-agent boss by donning a high-tech suit that enables him to foil villains plotting to sabotage the world's water supply. Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, Debi Mazar, Ritchie Coster, Peter Stormare(n)

programme.title: Everything Is Copy - Nora Ephron: Scripted & Unscripted
programme.desc: This moving documentary profiles multitalented writer Nora Ephron. Friends and family discuss the late Ephron's keen wit, her remarkable body of work—which includes everything from newspaper columns to classic films—and her private battle with leukemia(n)

When news of his survival is made public, a man whose own body is excessively weak tracks him down in an attempt to explain his unique unbreakable nature(n)

programme.title: Midnight Special

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, in his breakthrough role, stars as Joel Goodson, a straight-A student left in charge of the house by his holidaying parents. Grabbing the Porsche, he heads downtown and picks up a glamorous hooker. She's on the run from her pimp and when she sees Joel's house, she has an idea: seduce him and persuade him to turn it into a high class bordello for just one night, so she and her friends can relieve his friends of their cash. All goes well until her pimp turns up looking for payback in Paul Brickman's sex comedy that rises above the genre to be both entertaining and provoking(n)

programme.desc: Former Saturday Night Live "Weekend Update" co-anchors Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this baby-fever comedy about a single, career-oriented woman who previously put parenthood on hold, and is forced to hire a surrogate mother when she discovers there is only a one-in-a-million chance that she will be able to get pregnant. Kate Holbrook (Fey) is a 37-year-old business executive who has always put her professional life before her personal life, but these days her biological clock is ticking louder than ever before. As with everything else she has accomplished in life, Kate is determined to have a child on her own terms. Unfortunately for Kate, the chance of her ever becoming pregnant is slim to none. Undaunted, a willful Kate drafts South Philly working-class girl Angie Ostrowiski (Poehler) -- a woman who may just be her polar opposite -- to be a surrogate mother. Subsequently informed by the head of the surrogacy center (Sigourney Weaver) that her surrogate is indeed pregnant, the excited mother-to-be soon purchases every child-rearing book she can find and excitedly begins the nesting process. But life hasn't quit throwing Kate curveballs just yet, because when a pregnant Angie shows up on her doorstep with no place to live, the woman who once thrived on order finds her life descending into chaos. Now, as Kate attempts to transform Angie into the ideal expectant mother, this odd couple will discover that families aren't always biological, but occasionally formed through friendship as well. Writer Michael McCullers, who authored the screenplays for Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me and Undercover Brother in addition to working on Saturday Night Live, makes his feature directorial debut with a self-penned screenplay(n)

programme.title: Cloud Atlas
programme.desc: This epic comprises six tales from various historical eras. An 18th-century notary goes on a sea voyage; a musician becomes an apprentice to a famous composer in 1930s Belgium; a journalist uncovers corruption at a nuclear power plant in '70s California; a contemporary publisher seeks refuge from gangsters at a nursing home; a clone escapes her job at a fast-food establishment in futuristic Korea; a tribesman struggles to survive in a postapocalyptic wasteland(n)

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jackie Chan is a perfect fit in this stylish comedy-adventure about a cabbie-turned-chauffeur who fills in for his out-of-commission secret-agent boss by donning a high-tech suit that enables him to foil villains plotting to sabotage the world's water supply. Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, Debi Mazar, Ritchie Coster, Peter Stormare(n)

programme.title: Everything Is Copy - Nora Ephron: Scripted & Unscripted
programme.desc: This moving documentary profiles multitalented writer Nora Ephron. Friends and family discuss the late Ephron's keen wit, her remarkable body of work—which includes everything from newspaper columns to classic films—and her private battle with leukemia(n)

When news of his survival is made public, a man whose own body is excessively weak tracks him down in an attempt to explain his unique unbreakable nature(n)

Along with a state trooper, the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, in his breakthrough role, stars as Joel Goodson, a straight-A student left in charge of the house by his holidaying parents. Grabbing the Porsche, he heads downtown and picks up a glamorous hooker. She's on the run from her pimp and when she sees Joel's house, she has an idea: seduce him and persuade him to turn it into a high class bordello for just one night, so she and her friends can relieve his friends of their cash. All goes well until her pimp turns up looking for payback in Paul Brickman's sex comedy that rises above the genre to be both entertaining and provoking(n)

programme.desc: The Original. programme.title: Making of 'The Boss'
programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: Renaissance Man
programme.desc: Danny DeVito stars in this thoughtful comedy about Bill Rago, an advertising executive who gets fired from his job and is forced to take on an army job teaching poorly educated boot camp recruits to read. With a little ingenuity, he gets them reading Shakespeare's Hamlet, but finds opposition in the guise of Sgt Cass (Gregory Hines), who dislikes civilians and thinks he is wasting his time teaching screw-ups to think for themselves. Also stars Ed Begley Jr and a young Mark Wahlberg(n)

programme.title: HBO Comedy Half-Hour
programme.desc: Jeff Stilson. Jeff Stilson's routine covers a range of subjects, including divorce, men in delivery rooms, and math problems regarding bungee jumping. Taped in San Francisco at the Fillmore Auditorium(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: (1977) Mel Brooks' love of parodying film genres ( Young Frankenstein, Blazing Saddles ) continued with this affectionate spoof of Hitchcock's films, including Psycho, North by Northwest and Vertigo . Brooks plays Dr Richard H Thorndyke, new chief of the Psychoneurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous. There are mysterious disappearances, attempts on his life and scary Nurse Diesel (Cloris Leachman), whose closet is full of whips, as the gags fuel the delightfully crazy plot. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Three O'Clock High
programme.desc: The first feature film from director Phil Joanou (State of Grace), Three O' Clock High chronicles a high school nerd's much hyped after-school bout with the infamous class bully. When the impish Jerry Mitchell (Casey Siemaszko) is assigned to interview the new transfer student with a supposedly violent past, Buddy Revell (Richard Tyson), he makes the fatal mistake of touching his subject. Revell, who hates being touched, responds by challenging the unwilling Mitchell to a fight at three o'clock in the parking lot. Spanning the course of the school day, the film follows the disaster-bound Mitchell as he soils his good-boy image through various misguided attempts at averting the fight. Also making noteworthy appearances in the film are Jeffrey Tambor and Philip Baker Hall(n)

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: After their mother passes away, four estranged siblings return home to attend the traditional funeral she wanted(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: When it comes to dating, Christina Walters has a golden rule: avoid searching for Mr. Right and focus on Mr. Right Now. That is until one night at a club when she unexpectedly meets Peter, only to see him suddenly disappear the next day. She and her best friend Courtney decide to break the rules and go on a road trip to find him, encountering numerous misadventures along the way(n)

programme.title: Defending Your Life
programme.desc: Two spirits find love in an afterlife way station where fates are determined(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: In 1970s Los Angeles, bumbling private eye Holland March (Ryan Gosling) and muscle-for-hire Jackson Healy (Russell Crowe) become unlikely partners when they find themselves both looking for a missing woman named Amelia (Margaret Qualley) following the death of a high-profile porn star. Amelia's ties to the deceased actress are unclear, but as other members of the porn industry turn up dead, March and Healy's investigation reveals a much bigger conspiracy than the duo could have ever anticipated. With the help of March's teenage daughter Holly (Angourie Rice), their sleuthing eventually unearths corruption within the federal government. Shane Black (Iron Man 3) directed and co-wrote this action buddy comedy, which co-stars Kim Basinger and Matt Bomer(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: A janitor at MIT, Will Hunting has a gift for maths that can take him light-years beyond his blue-collar roots, but to achieve his dream he must turn his back on the neighborhood and his best friend. To complicate matters, two strangers enter the equation: a washed-up shrink who starts to coach Will through his transformation, and a med student who shows him that there can be a pretty face along with his life of the mind(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: After the highly acclaimed independent film Bottle Rocket, director Wes Anderson followed up with a quirky Touchstone Studios film entitled Rushmore. Written by Anderson and friend Owen Wilson (an actor in Armageddon and Anaconda), they created the story of Max Fischer, a highly eccentric 15-year-old boy who attends the tenth grade at Rushmore Academy. Played by Jason Schwartzman (Talia Shire's son and Francis Ford Coppola's nephew), Max is a poor student with big dreams and a love of extracurricular activities. Max is editor of the school newspaper and yearbook, president of the chess, astronomy, French, and German clubs, captain of the fencing team, and director of the school play. Max is also a compulsive liar, telling everyone that his barber father (Seymour Cassel) is really a brain surgeon. Suddenly Max falls in love with Miss Cross (Olivia Williams), a first-grade teacher at the school. He also makes a new friend in business tycoon Mr. Blume (Bill Murray), an eccentric millionaire who also loves Miss Cross. The love triangle heats up as Max refuses to believe that his age has anything to do with Miss Cross refusing his romantic advances. Also Max's scheme to erect an aquarium on the school baseball diamond gets him booted out of Rushmore Academy. As his life crumbles around him, he is forced to grow up and accept the consequences of his actions and his lies. He throws himself more into his extracurricular activities, hoping to redeem himself by staging the most ambitious school play ever attempted(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: When it comes to dating, Christina Walters has a golden rule: avoid searching for Mr. Right and focus on Mr. Right Now. That is until one night at a club when she unexpectedly meets Peter, only to see him suddenly disappear the next day. She and her best friend Courtney decide to break the rules and go on a road trip to find him, encountering numerous misadventures along the way(n)

programme.desc: A convicted car thief walks away from minimum security prison after winning tickets to the world series. When he finds a wealthy businessman's planner, he takes a trip to return the items - on the businessman's dime and name(n)

programme.title: Evil Dead 2: Dead by Dawn
programme.desc: Special effects and humour blend in a sequel about teens trapped in a haunted cabin(n)

programme.title: Nothing but Trouble
programme.desc: Actor Dan Aykroyd made his directorial debut with this bizarre comic fantasy. Financier Chris Thorne (Chevy Chase) hopes to impress beautiful Diane Lightson (Demi Moore), so he invites her along for a trip to Atlantic City, with a pair of wealthy Brazilians, Fausto (Taylor Negron) and Renalda (Bertila Damas) tagging along for the ride. After running a stop sign in a small town just off the New Jersey turnpike, Chris and his friends are pulled over and arrested by a motorcycle cop named Denis (John Candy). The travellers are brought before J.P. (Aykroyd), the ancient and vindictive Justice of the Peace in the very strange village of Valkevania, where minor traffic offenses are usually punished by torture or death. While Fausto and Renalda are able to escape, Chris and Diane find themselves trapped in a bizarre underground maze in which fellow tourists like themselves must fight for their lives. Keep an eye peeled for the screen debut of Tupac Shakur, who appears as a member of the rap group Digital Underground(n)

programme.title: King Ralph
programme.desc: Sometimes a family title, among the nobility of England, goes to the "collateral" heirs -- people not in the direct line of decent, like cousins, great-nephews and the like. On rare occasions, these people are not even aware that they are about to be elevated to the House of Lords, and they have been living more-or-less ordinary lives. In this comedy, the family which lacks direct heirs is the Royal Family of England -- as all of the likely heirs have died one after the other in swift succession. In this comedy, the "collateral heir" is an exuberant, fence-busting All-American slob (and pretty good rock n' roll musician) by the name of Ralph (John Goodman). Unknown to him, his grandmother had an affair with a royal prince. Ralph's a good guy, and eager to please. He recognizes the importance of the royal hoopla to England and works very hard to fit in as its new designated king. He is assisted by the ever-unctuous, very serious family factotum Willingham (Peter O'Toole). The trouble is, he doesn't have instincts for politics English-style, and he is constantly "putting a foot wrong," as they might say. The most difficult situation for him is when he develops a new love interest, and she's not "acceptable" to the upper crust. In addition to being hounded by the tabloids, he finds that "the good of the state" requires that he drop his new girlfriend. Things really come to a head just before Ralph's coronation as king. Reviewers generally loathed this feel-good comedy, but audiences seem to have enjoyed it tremendously, and it has done well in video and TV airings(n)

programme.title: Quick Change
programme.desc: A disgruntled New Yorker and two accomplices rob a bank to finance their escape from the city(n)

programme.title: Disney's The Kid
programme.desc: If you could talk to the child that you used to be, what advice would you give him? That question forms the basis of this comic fantasy. Forty-year-old Russ Duritz (Bruce Willis) is a wealthy and powerful "image consultant" who has made a career out of telling people how to present themselves. But while he's a success in business, he's a failure in life; he's vain, mean-spirited, and hasn't been able to hold onto a marriage (or even a pet dog). One day, Russ is startled to meet Rusty (Spencer Breslin), a stocky kid whom he soon realizes is himself at the age of eight, having passed through a wrinkle in time. Young Rusty doesn't seem much happier than the grown-up Russ, so the older man takes his younger self under his wing and tries to teach him how to avoid the mistakes he's made, while Rusty encourages Russ to be a more caring human being. Along the way, Russ and Rusty become friends, and realize how much they can learn from each other. Disney's The Kid also stars Jean Smart as one of Russ' clients, Lily Tomlin as his assistant, and Daniel Von Bargen as his father(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Hawk-like Marine Corps officer Benson Payne (Damon Wayans) attempts to whip into shape the usual assortment of misfit JROTC kids in this minor remake of The Private War of Major Benson. Of course, both the major and his pint-sized recruits have something to teach one another. Payne teaches them the value of self-discipline and instills self-confidence in them, and the recruits teach him to stop and smell the roses (not to mention the fact that kids sometimes need coddling rather than screaming). And, of course, there is the annual JROTC statewide competition, which the kids are obligated to win before the movie can end. While there are some funny moments (the major's exhibition in full-dress whites at a school dance, for example), the script seems too color-by-numbers to be interesting to anyone other than undiscriminating younger viewers(n)

But instead of selling it to his drug lord employer, he jets to Liverpool where Robert Carlyle is acting as broker for Ricky Tomlinson, who's prepared to offer $20m for the formula - money Jackson would love to spend if he can stay alive long enough in Ronny Yu's fast moving crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Funny Games
programme.desc: Michael Haneke's American re-make of his 1997 German version loses none of the terror or horror in the translation. An all-American family - George, Ann and son Georgie - arrive at their summer cottage for a yachting holiday. Two polite young men, Paul and Peter introduce themselves as neighbours but suddenly and brutally instil a nihilistic, sadistic regime on the family, playing mind games and torturing them. Haneke famously makes the audience complicit to events, rewinding events, having Paul and Peter address the audience directly and making the violence happen off screen but having it still horribly audible in this claustrophobic nightmare(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Former Saturday Night Live "Weekend Update" co-anchors Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this baby-fever comedy about a single, career-oriented woman who previously put parenthood on hold, and is forced to hire a surrogate mother when she discovers there is only a one-in-a-million chance that she will be able to get pregnant. Kate Holbrook (Fey) is a 37-year-old business executive who has always put her professional life before her personal life, but these days her biological clock is ticking louder than ever before. As with everything else she has accomplished in life, Kate is determined to have a child on her own terms. Unfortunately for Kate, the chance of her ever becoming pregnant is slim to none. Undaunted, a willful Kate drafts South Philly working-class girl Angie Ostrowiski (Poehler) -- a woman who may just be her polar opposite -- to be a surrogate mother. Subsequently informed by the head of the surrogacy center (Sigourney Weaver) that her surrogate is indeed pregnant, the excited mother-to-be soon purchases every child-rearing book she can find and excitedly begins the nesting process. But life hasn't quit throwing Kate curveballs just yet, because when a pregnant Angie shows up on her doorstep with no place to live, the woman who once thrived on order finds her life descending into chaos. Now, as Kate attempts to transform Angie into the ideal expectant mother, this odd couple will discover that families aren't always biological, but occasionally formed through friendship as well. Writer Michael McCullers, who authored the screenplays for Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me and Undercover Brother in addition to working on Saturday Night Live, makes his feature directorial debut with a self-penned screenplay(n)

Upon returning to her hometown to once again be a bridesmaid in yet another wedding, jet-lagged, gin-soaked travel writer Pippa McGee (Graham) soon learns that her tyrannical publishing magnate father has been hospitalized after suffering a serious heart attack. As Pippa rushes to his bedside and the ailing mogul asks her to take editorial control of one of his most popular magazines, her excitement soon turns sour upon learning that the magazine in question is not a political or travel magazine, but the one and only Wedding Bells monthly. Determined to succeed despite the constant reminders of just how single she truly is, Pippa is horrified to learn that the man her father has chosen as her publishing mentor is the same man that she drunkenly came on to at her close friend's recent wedding(n)

programme.title: White Palace
programme.desc: Screenwriters Ted Tally and Alvin Sargent adapted the novel by Glenn Savan into this intelligent drama about a May-December romance where the woman is the senior partner. James Spader is Max Baron, a 27-year-old St. Louis advertising executive who has completely shut himself off from the world in the two years since the auto accident death of his wife. When he meets free-spirited, 43-year-old burger joint waitress Nora Baker (Susan Sarandon), his attraction to the earthy, outspoken woman is immediate and overpowering. The difference in age isn't their only obstacle happiness: Nora's into Marilyn Monroe, drinking beer, and lives in Dogtown, the city's low-rent district, while Max is cultured, sophisticated, and wealthy. Despite their differences, Max and Nora are alike in their suffering and in their deep need for connection, but their charged relationship is put to the emotional test when it becomes clear that Max is hiding his affair with Nora from his upper middle-class, Jewish social circle. White Palace co-stars Renée Taylor, Eileen Brennan, Kathy Bates, Jason Alexander, and Corey Parker(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: Die Hard 2
programme.desc: "Another basement, another elevator...how can the same thing happen to the same guy twice?" asks John McClane (Bruce Willis), in what is doubtless the key question of this film. A year after foiling the terrorist takeover of a high-rise office building in the first movie, McClane is waiting to pick up his wife, Holly (Bonnie Bedelia), at Dulles International Airport just outside Washington, D.C., on Christmas Eve. Scheduled to arrive the same evening is Ramon Esperanza (Franco Nero), a South American political figure who is being brought to the United States to stand trial for his role in a drug-smuggling ring. However, a group of terrorists, led by renegade American military officer Col. Stuart (William Sadler), take control of the airport, scuttling radio transmissions and placing their own men in the control tower. Stuart and his men ensure that Esperanza's plane lands safely, and then demand that Stuart and his men be given a fully-fueled 747 and free passage wherever they choose to go. Otherwise, they will guide the many circling jets waiting for landing instructions into definite crash landings, killing the many passengers on board. Not willing to stand aside as terrorists once again threaten his wife's life, the wise-cracking McClane once again leaps into action to foil Stuart's plans and bring the passenger jets safely to the ground. William Atherton, John Amos, Dennis Franz, and John Leguizamo highlight the supporting cast(n)

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.sub-title: It All Comes Down to This
programme.desc: It All Comes Down to This. On the Season 1 finale, Brockmire makes a decision. He must choose between staying in Morristown or returning to the major leagues(n)

programme.title: Flashdance
programme.desc: Jennifer Beals stars as Alex Owens, a Pittsburgh steel-mill welder by day, and bar dancer by night. Harboring dreams of a career in ballet, she is given financial support in this endeavor by her boss Nick Hurley (Michael Nouri) and moral support by demanding but big-hearted instructor Hanna Long (Lilia Skala). The film's signature scene is, of course, Alex's water-drenched dance audition, largely performed in long shot by her dance double Marine Jahan. Essentially an old-fashioned backstage yarn, Flashdance was given a contemporary spin by its pulsating, musical score featuring the Oscar-winning Best Song, Flashdance...What a Feeling, (music by Giorgio Moroder, lyrics by Keith Forsey and Irene Cara)(n)

programme.title: Jackie Brown
programme.desc: Quentin Tarantino's slick third film, based on an Elmore Leonard novel, is a tight thriller centred around blaxploitation star Pam Grier, who plays Jackie Brown, a strong woman approaching the end of her career as an air hostess. She's been trafficking 'hot' money for gangster Ordell Robbie, but when she ends up carrying enough cash to retire on, she decides to fly solo, so long as she can outfox Ordell, the cops and the feds. Also starring Robert Forster, Bridget Fonda and Robert De Niro(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Cradle of Life
programme.desc: As the feisty video-game heroine, Angelina Jolie shifts into overdrive in this high-tech, fast-paced sequel. This time around Lara and her ex, a disgraced British agent turned mercenary, set out to retrieve Pandora's box. An evil scientist wants to use the legendary box to create a biological weapon(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: In Paul Verhoeven's wild sci-fi action movie Total Recall, Arnold Schwarzenegger plays a 21st-century construction worker who discovers that his entire memory of the past derives from a memory chip implanted in his brain. Schwarzenegger learns that he's actually a secret agent who had become a threat to the government, so those in power planted the chip and invented a domestic lifestyle for him. Once he has realized his true identity, he travels to Mars to piece together the rest of his identity, as well as to find the man responsible for his implanted memory. Verhoeven has created a fast, furious action film with Total Recall, filled with impressive stunts and (literally) eye-popping visuals. Though the film bears only a passing resemblance to the Philip K. Dick short story it was based on ("We Can Remember It For You Wholesale"), the movie is an entertaining, if very violent, ride(n)

programme.title: The Tournament
programme.desc: The world's best assassins converge upon the streets of a small Scottish town to compete in a deadly tournament in which the last killer standing gets a million-dollar prize while wealthy thrillseekers watch a live video stream and gamble on the outcome. Robert Carlyle (Trainspotting) stars as a local priest who becomes an unwitting participant in the grisly contest in this adrenaline-fueled action film from director Scott Mann(n)

programme.title: The Punisher
programme.desc: Following the murder of his family at the hands of vicious organised criminals, cop Frank Castle leaves his old life behind to bring bloody justice to those responsible. Action(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III
programme.desc: Tom Cruise reprises his role as IMF agent Ethan Hunt, master of disguise and the double bluff. In JJ Abrams' fast-faced thriller, he's up against Owen Davian, who is planning to sell a new deadly weapon's system, code-named the 'Rabbit's Foot' to the highest bidder. Cue a stunning helicopter chase through a wind farm, a parachute drop that leaves Hunt dangling in front of a speeding truck and an unholy finale in the Vatican City, bringing the franchise to a punchy conclusion(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Nerds IV: Nerds in Love
programme.desc: The silly spirit of Revenge of the Nerds lives on in this made-for-television sequel. Curtis Armstrong returns as Booger, and this time around the nerds are gathering for his wedding to a wealthy upper-class girl. As the nerds plan a wild bachelor party, the girl's father is busy hiring an investigator to look into Booger's past and hopefully stop the wedding(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Nerds
programme.desc: A university outcast leads his fellow nerds in a war of pranks against campus jocks who have taken over their fraternity house(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Punk Chick. Steve Hyde (Danny Masterson) falls in love with Chrissy (Jade Gordon), a tough chick who is "Hyde" in female form -- right down to the conspiracy theories. Things come to a head when Chrissy tries luring Hyde to New York. Elsehwere, Kelso (Ashton Kutcher) and Red (Kurtwood Smith) form an unlikely partnership; Eric (Topher Grace) aspires to get to "second base" with Donna (Laura Prepon); and Jackie (Mila Kunis) makes several fruitless efforts to bake a cake. With all this happening, no wonder poor Fez (Wilmer Valderrama) feels left out(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Grandma's Dead. Eric (Topher Grace) finally tells Grandma (Marion Ross) why her visits are so unwelcome. It wouldn't hurt her, he insists, to be nice to his folks. Evidently, Eric is wrong, since Grandma "responds" by promptly dropping dead. As Eric spends the rest of the episode suffering pangs of guilt -- and nursing a black eye -- his mother, Kitty (Debra Jo Rupp), doesn't quite know how to respond to the tragedy, especially since, with Grandma no longer around, she can go back to smoking. Pat Skipper guest stars as Marty, the slightly light in the loafers brother of Red Foreman (Kurtwood Smith)(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Hyde Moves In. When his mother runs off with a trucker -- not to mention all the money in the house -- Hyde (Danny Masterson) moves in with Eric (Topher Grace) and his family. While Eric welcomes Hyde's presence, his father (Kurtwood Smith) has other words for the situation -- and many of them are bleeped from the soundtrack! Elsewhere, Jackie (Mila Kunis) has a mishap while everyone goes skinny-dipping. Carlos Alazraqui, the voice of the Taco Bell Chihuahua, appears in a cameo(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The Good Son. Eric began to love having Hyde as a homemate but is upset when he thinks his parents like Hyde more(n)

programme.desc: Garage Sale. In the Season 2 opener, Hyde makes pot-laced brownies for the Formans' garage sale, and a stoned Red sells Eric's car(n)

programme.desc: A look behind the scenes of the Share a Story competition, meeting the competitors and the animators who turned their stories into short films.(n)

programme.desc: Trek learns that he can see dinosaurs, just like his older brother Dan.(n)

programme.desc: When Hannah's Dad takes Trek and Hannah to fly remote control helicopters, Trek uses the opportunity to learn about the pterodaustro.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Hen with the Golden Eggs.
programme.desc: Ruby acquires the skill to turn anything she touches into gold, but is held prisoner by Sharkbeard - so Alex, Twinkle, the Alien and Genie try to save her.(n)

programme.title: Marvel Avengers Assemble
programme.desc: Iron Man and Captain America's relationship becomes strained when Cap discovers Iron Man has been hiding dangerous information about an artificial intelligence unit named Ultron.(n)

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Brains and Alan visit the Supreme Hadron Collider, but are put in danger when a satellite falls from the sky and heads straight towards them. Virgil flies to the rescue, but discovers an even greater threat - the satellite was being pulled to Earth by a gravity well, which is now pulling in nearby aircraft.(n)

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: A mysterious device gives 10-year-old Ben Tennyson the power to change into an assortment of alien heroes, each with unique powers.(n)

programme.title: Weekend
programme.desc: Aled Jones is joined by Neighbours star Jackie Woodburne and presenter and actress Laura Whitmore. The cast of Carole King musical Beautiful perform two numbers from the show.(n)

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury: Fell Walk: Pen-Y-Ghent, Yorkshire.
programme.desc: At 694 metres in height, Pen-y-ghent is the smallest fell on the Yorkshire Three Peaks Challenge, but the dramatic summit affords far-reaching views above the Dales, with plenty of surprises en route. The peak lies 3km east of Horton in Ribblesdale and the Pennine Way links the summit to the village. As Julia reveals, the route is around 5km in length, as the Way curves initially to the north before turning east to reach the summit.(n)

programme.title: Peston on Sunday
programme.desc: Political magazine, presented by Robert Peston, featuring reports on the latest issues and interviews with topical guests.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.(n)

programme.title: All Star Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Vernon Kay. Well-known faces team up with their relatives and try to guess the answers to surveys of 100 people in a bid to reach the final round, in which they can win up to £30,000 for a charity of their choice.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Live: Michael Carrick Testimonial
programme.desc: Manchester United '08 XI v Michael Carrick All Star XI (Kick-off 2.30pm). Jacqui Oatley presents coverage of the match at Old Trafford honouring the career of the longstanding Red Devils midfielder. Alex Ferguson returns to manage the United XI featuring players from the famous Champions League-winning squad of 2008, including Edwin van der Sar, Gary Neville, Rio Ferdinand, Paul Scholes, Ryan Giggs, Nemanja Vidic and Wayne Rooney. The opposition is managed by Harry Redknapp and features the likes of Steven Gerrard, Frank Lampard, Michael Owen, John Terry and Jamie Carragher. With commentary by Sam Matterface.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring a man hunting mosquitos with a bow and arrow, a child demolishing his mother's kitchen, a house being wrecked in just one hour and a clam that looks like Mick Jagger.(n)

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to `see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000.(n)

programme.title: The Queen
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama, examining the events surrounding the death of Princess Diana. The relationship between the monarch and Prime Minister Tony Blair is revealed as they struggle to reach a compromise in dealing with the situation. Starring Helen Mirren in an Oscar-winning role, alongside Michael Sheen, James Cromwell, Helen McCrory and Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Election Face to Face
programme.desc: Bernard Ponsonby interviews a leading politician on key issues facing voters in the run-up to the Scottish Parliament election.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Home Secrets
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter visits her former home in London, sharing memories and secrets from her time there. She also reveals what she most enjoys doing in her current Yorkshire residence.(n)

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alastair Stewart presents a selection of extraordinary eyewitness footage filmed by members of the public, and meets those who just happened to be there at the right time to record jaw-dropping moments. Featuring some of Britain's worst storms in decades, encounters with nature - like the man who found himself being groomed by a family of gorillas - and dramatic rescues, including a construction worker who was trapped on the balcony of a building engulfed by a huge blaze.(n)

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Action from Donington Park, featuring the Renault UK Clio Cup and the Ginetta GT4 Supercup. Presented by Richard John Neil.(n)

In the first edition, he focuses on the deaths of six children in a house fire in Derby, where Mick and Mairead Philpott quickly became prime suspects, and the murder of 67-year-old Rita Stephens in Penoced, Bridgend, for which police arrested her son Mark.(n)

programme.title: Masterpiece with Alan Titchmarsh

programme.title: Tonight

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Nathan persuades Bethany to lie and inform her mum they have split up, and Ken shocks his family when he tells them the truth about what happened on the night of his attack. Elsewhere, Johnny is impressed by Gina's work and promotes her to machinist.(n)

programme.title: Lord Lucan: My Husband, The Truth
programme.desc: The Countess of Lucan reveals the inside story of her marriage to John Bingham, 7th Earl of Lucan, and the events surrounding the death of their nanny Sandra Rivett in 1974. She talks about their sparsely-attended wedding and aborted honeymoon, the births of their three children, the bitter custody battle that drove her husband to the brink of bankruptcy; and the attack on herself and Sandra Rivett in November 1974 that led to his disappearance.(n)

Romantic drama, adapted from the novel by Louis de Bernieres, starring Nicolas Cage, Penelope Cruz and Christian Bale.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.title: The Nun's Story
programme.desc: An independent-minded woman enters a convent and develops a gift for medicine, while struggling to curb her rebellious nature. She is sent to the Congo to assist a doctor in his work, but suffers a crisis of faith at the outbreak of the Second World War. Drama, based on Kathryn C Hulme's novel, starring Audrey Hepburn, Peter Finch, Peggy Ashcroft, Dean Jagger and Mildred Dunnock.(n)

programme.title: The Nun's Story

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crack'd from Side to Side.
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the star's unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: Foyle investigates what he believes to be a burglary at the headquarters of a multinational company, and the murder of a Home Guard member during a large-scale exercise on the Sussex Downs soon leads him to believe the firm are conducting covert business with the Nazis - and that his former police sergeant may be involved. Second World War crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Anthony Howell.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Lady Virginia Revel receives a marriage proposal from an ambitious politician, but is reluctant to accept it, especially as she is also being courted by a dashing young suitor. Accompanied by Miss Marple, she travels to a weekend party at her family home Chimneys, hoping to reach a decision. Negotiations for the sale of the country house are taking place during the gathering, but when new owner Count Ludwig of Austria is found murdered, St Mary Mead's elderly spinster must identify the culprit. Whodunit, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast including Gavin & Stacey stars Ruth Jones and Mathew Horne, plus Dervla Kirwan, Charlotte Salt, Michelle Collins, Jonas Armstrong and Edward Fox.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bullard asks Barnaby to investigate the disappearance of a friend's daughter who was a member of the Oblong Foundation, a cult based at Malham Hall. Jones goes under cover as a new recruit to solve the mystery, but he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion, which could be linked to the missing woman. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Will Knightley, Kevin Doyle, Holly Aird, Barbara Flynn and John Woodvine.(n)

programme.title: Tommy Cooper: Not Like That, Like This
programme.desc: Feature-length biopic of the much-loved comedian, written by Simon Nye and starring David Threlfall. When Tommy's extensive touring starts to affect his home life and his health, his doting wife Gwen, whom he nicknamed Dove, decides she cannot go on the road with him any longer, so he asks stage manager Mary to act as his assistant. Her unwavering support makes all the difference to the star's performances and the pair soon embark on an affair. For the next 17 years, Tommy finds himself unable to choose between these two equally devoted women, and his death on live TV in 1984 means he never makes that decision. With Amanda Redman, Helen McCrory, Jason Manford, Gregor Fisher and Paul Ritter.(n)

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The surly detective tries to get out of attending a reunion of George Cross holders because a serial rapist has struck again on his patch. Righteous indignation prompts him to take the most desperate professional gamble of his entire career by using PC Hazel Wallace as bait in a trap. He eventually picks up a lead involving the most recent victim's father, but comes under pressure from within the force to back down or be thrown off the case. David Jason stars.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: May the Best House Win
programme.desc: Four proud homeowners in the Derbyshire countryside compete to win the £1,000 prize. Next is Rachel Dale's modern semi-detached home full of bling, and the tours end at saleswoman Jacqui Mather's converted watermill.(n)

programme.title: May the Best House Win

programme.desc: A body is found with a note reading `They Must Be Destroyed' - a chilling reminder of a case Brooks was involved in six years previously, when extreme racist Andrew Dillon killed three boys from ethnic minorities. programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the eighth day's play at Roland Garros, where the fourth-round singles matches are scheduled to get under way in the second Grand Slam tournament of the year. Andy Murray continued his run to the final at this stage in 2016 with a 7-6. 6-4. 6-3 victory over John Isner, while 2015 champion Stan Wawrinka defeated Viktor Troicki 7-6, 6-7, 6-3, 6-3, and home favourite Richard Gasquet overcame fifth seed Kei Nishikori 6-4, 6-2, 4.6, 6-2. In the women's competition, eventual champion Garbine Muguruza prevailed 6-3, 6-4 against 2009 title-winner Svetlana Kuznetsova, and Shelby Rogers won by the same scoreline against Irina-Camelia Begu. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier, Mark Petchey, Fabrice Santoro and Sam Smith, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

This day in 2016 saw a full day's play cancelled for the first time in 16 years due to heavy rain. The organisers, players and fans will desperately be hoping for more friendly weather conditions this time around, as while a roof is being planned for Court Philippe Chatrier, it is not scheduled to be ready until 2020.
