programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The culinary contest arrives in Hull as five more diners hope to claim the grand prize of £1,000. The first to host a party this week is 29-year-old welfare team leader Jennie, who decides to honour her home city's fishing history with an under-the-sea themed dinner. However, her guests prove to be a lively bunch, twerking their way through dinner, and throwing in a few seal impressions along the way.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wrestling promoter and novice cook James hosts the second night in Hull, and he hopes to wow his guests with a Mexican-themed party complete with a wrestling match as the evening's entertainment. However, his costume requirements, and his spicy food, may be too much for some of the attendees.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wedding stationery entrepreneur Katrena hosts the third dinner party in Hull, and hopes to impress her guests with a cruise-ship-themed night featuring a pink strawberry soup starter, a sparkling lemon iceberg dessert and towel-folding entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mum-of-three Natalie hopes that her choice of good quality produce can help her to impress her guests on the fourth night of the competition in Hull, East Yorkshire. However, the evening does not get off to the best start when community manager George wrongly guesses that she is the grandmother of her two-year-old daughter, and entrepreneur Katrena is insulted by one of the host's questions.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party in Hull and the turn of community manager George to entertain the guests. Having spent the week heavily criticising everyone else's cooking, the host faces great scrutiny with his menu of simple yet tasty favourites. It remains to be seen whether his egg drop soup and flambeed crepes Suzettes live up to expectations, before the winner of the cash prize is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Timothy West and Prunella Scales embark on more waterway adventures. This time, they head into uncharted waters to attempt one of the longest canal journeys in the world - 350 miles coast to coast across Sweden. The first leg of their voyage begins in Gothenburg, where they link up with the historic Gota Canal, taking them into the heart of the Scandinavian country and toward the Baltic Sea.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Timothy West and Prunella Scales continue their Swedish canal odyssey, following the ancient routes of the Vikings and travelling to Stockholm, where they navigate the city's canals. They later head out into the far-flung islands of the archipelago, before paying a visit to Drottningholm Palace Theatre, where they meet Wallander actor Krister Henriksson.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Timothy West and Prunella Scales travel down the Stratford-upon-Avon Canal, accompanied by Tim's daughter and her family. The couple revisit places that hold fond memories from the early stages of their relationship, as well as looking back on the beginnings of their acting careers and putting on a performance in the church where Shakespeare is buried.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Union Inn in Cowes on the Isle of Wight, where owner Olivia Adams and best friend Rebecca Nugent try to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, tensions in the group are created by a `hair-gate' scandal and a raft-building exercise that becomes overly competitive.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Shoreside Inn in Shanklin, on the Isle of Wight, run by Andy Steele and Jo Ratje. The B&B is used to receiving rave reviews for the quality of its rooms, but a jungle-themed face-painting activity causes tension among the rivals, and breakfast fails to live up to expectation.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From KirriBilli guest house in Newquay, Cornwall, where Raj Odedra happily caters for stag and hen parties and can't wait to get the party started. However, Jackie is horrified by the prospect of sleeping in a bunk bed, and all the guests gang up on Raj in a game of tug-of-war.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Hotel aficionado Jackie Burchell welcomes the contestants to Elysian Fields in Helston, Cornwall, which offers a wide selection of wine and personalised lollipops. However, things take a turn for the worse when the conversation at the dinner table focuses on room names.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured in the show reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former property developer Ian hosts the first dinner party in Gloucestershire, hoping his super-healthy menu will win him the £1,000 prize - although it is possible his guests may be more impressed with his 12-bedroom mansion in the country. Some naked antics, a pinata and stories of millions pounds won and lost make it a night to remember.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Reigning Miss Cheltenham Sophie hosts the second dinner party in Gloucestershire, hoping her evening of elegant food and pageantry will win her the £1,000 prize. The 24-year-old reveals what she does for a living to her guests, and one attendee makes a surprising confession of her own.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby-loving Carmel hosts the third dinner party in Gloucestershire, and she hopes to impress with a `Six Nations' starter, a pancetta, king prawn and chorizo main, and a Key lime pie for dessert. An attempt to charm her guests backfires when she likens Ian to a psychotic killer, and the atmosphere takes a further knock after Chris gets on the wrong side of Sophie.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: School teacher Polly, 40, hosts the fourth night of the competition in Gloucestershire, and hopes to impress her guests with a fine-dining experience. She begins with a seafood starter before serving up a meaty main course, and isn't unnerved by the fact she hasn't had any practise cooking either dish. However, her guests show off round the table and threaten to take the attention away from the night, but Ian is highly impressed with Polly's choice of entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the turn of exuberant hair salon owner Chris to host the final dinner party in Gloucestershire with home-made treats on the menu, including a tiger prawn starter, venison for the main and a dessert of chocolate and walnut ice-cream. Chat around the table reveals some differing opinions after the guests make a discovery in the host's living room, and the group reflect on their time together before the winner of the cash prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Rothschild giraffe Orla is about to give birth to her second calf but is three weeks overdue. This episode captures the arrival of the giraffe family's youngest member and its introduction to the rest of the herd. Cameras also follow the Chester team as they attempt to save mountain chicken frogs from extinction, and there's a look at the secret world of three disruptive aardvarks.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The attractive author of a steamy novel comes to stay on Craggy Island - and it is not long before Ted mistakenly jumps to the conclusion that she has fallen for him. Guest starring Gemma Craven.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Jack is declared dead after drinking too much floor polish - and Ted is astounded to learn he has been left a fortune in the will. However, he has to fulfil certain conditions before collecting the money.(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood
programme.desc: An archer fighting in Richard the Lionheart's crusading army returns home to England and assumes the identity of a nobleman killed in battle. His new-found status draws him into a dangerous conflict with members of the newly crowned King John's court, and a traitorous knight plots to aid the French in conquering England. Ridley Scott's medieval adventure, starring Russell Crowe, Cate Blanchett and Mark Strong.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Connecticut's oldest inn, the Curtis House in Woodbury, which has been owned by the Hardisty family for generations. However, the business has started to fall apart and their legacy is on the brink of being lost. Siblings Chris and TJ, who are in charge, no longer speak to each other and the staff and guests feel stuck in the middle.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Rothschild giraffe Orla is about to give birth to her second calf but is three weeks overdue. This episode captures the arrival of the giraffe family's youngest member and its introduction to the rest of the herd. Cameras also follow the Chester team as they attempt to save mountain chicken frogs from extinction, and there's a look at the secret world of three disruptive aardvarks.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: An extended version of the irreverent panel show. Jimmy Carr welcomes team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock, and guests Russell Kane, Rachel Riley, Alex Reid and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions based on opinion polls.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps retired couple Paul and Lindy, from the Midlands, search for a suitable property on the Costa del Azahar in Spain.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick takes a look at 12-year-old cat Pixie, who has been hit by a car and brought in by owner Diane. The vet believes he can help the animal walk again with the aid of a revolutionary bionic implant. A Great Dane called Ellie has deformed bones and discs pressing down on her spinal cord, but Noel hopes to relieve the dog's pain by placing bone marrow taken from her shoulder into a special scaffolding in her neck, helping the vertebrae fuse together. Meanwhile, receptionist Natalie introduces a new arrival to the team.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tim and Jules Anderson are first to host at the King's Head and Queen's Jules in Suffolk, where they provide their guests with a lesson in how to fillet fish, and an evening of karaoke. However, the owners find criticism hard to take the following morning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gordon and Blossom welcome their rivals to the Hotel Continental in Harwich, Essex, where they are greeted by an erotic art display. The guests enjoy participating in a poetry reading during the afternoon, each writing their own piece, but the morning's breakfast goes awry after the hosts have a disagreement.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ryan Davies has to deal with a crisis when the contestants stay his five-star B&B Llanerch Vineyard in south Wales, but still manages to impress with his location and selection of wines. However, Gordon and Blossom go on a fault-finding mission and leave feedback the host is not happy with.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Neil and Tracy Bullows, owners of the Whitehall Hotel in Darwen, Lancashire, play host to the last night of the week's competition. Hoping to impress with a mix of professionalism and efficiency, they decide to take their guests on a tour of a local paint factory, but tempers fray and a stony silence follows at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Jasmine Harman has her work cut out as she tries to help Gordon Sandilands and his partner Louisa Hunter find a second home in Murcia, Spain for less than £100,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton tries to help model agency boss Susan Mitchell and her friend Sara Minton find their dream holiday home in Gran Canaria.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Standish, Gloucestershire: Going Upmarket with the Romans.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew scour a field near Standish in Gloucestershire for signs of a Roman villa. While plenty of evidence of the building has been found, there is no trace of the structure itself. As the archaeologists search the area, they uncover signs of habitation from the Iron Age to the Roman era and discover the story of a family that lived through a tumultuous period of social change.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team explore Wemyss Caves in Fife, a landmark thought to have been inhabited by the Picts - a people so fearsome the Romans built Hadrian's Wall to keep them at bay. The experts examine the caverns, which are gradually eroding, hoping to find evidence of the native inhabitants, as well as the possibility of later occupants such as medieval Christian hermits and Jacobean nobles.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Schrodinger the cat is brought in with a shattered thighbone after being hit by a car, and Noel Fitzpatrick prepares to fuse the broken pieces back together in an all-night operation. Plus, English bulldog Lois is put on a strict diet and given an exercise regimen, and an elderly springer spaniel called Flossie, who has lost control of her back legs, arrives at the clinic.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw lead a team of experts who secretly restore classic cars for their unsuspecting owners. They continue by helping James Hutchings-Clarke, whose entire family drive Ford Anglias, but whose own vehicle does not even have an engine.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets dairy farmer Andrew Ainslie and his artist wife Meryl in Marlborough, Wiltshire. Their current house is separate from their land, so they want to build a new home close to their 200-head herd of cattle. The project involves constructing an ultra-modern barn-like building from engineered timber, with a barrel-shaped zinc roof, which will combine functionality with high-finish craftsmanship.(n)

programme.title: Hunt for the Arctic Ghost Ship
programme.desc: Cameras follow the multimillion-dollar expedition that discovered the Victorian ship HMS Erebus, intact and upright on the Arctic sea floor in September 2014. The story unfolds in the freezing Arctic, where search vessels battled with heavy sea-ice that threatened to stop the search entirely, to the dramatic chain of events that led to the historic discovery.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 61-year-old woman is airlifted to hospital after a car mounted the pavement and ran her over and doctors quickly get her into the CT scanner to ascertain the full extent of her injuries. Elsewhere, 91-year-old Sam arrives after suffering a suspected stroke, and four-month-old boy Teddy is rushed in after falling face first out of his car seat, hitting the pavement.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The documentary follows paramedics as they deal with people who have mental health problems. Maria Stanley is called to a multi-storey car park, where she tries to talk a man away from the edge, while Kirsten Harper and Amy Siddall race to help a father who is having suicidal thoughts. In London, crews attend the scene of a failed suicide attempt that has left a middle-aged man trapped under a train.(n)

programme.title: The Ellen DeGeneres Show
programme.desc: The Ellen DeGeneres Show, often shortened to Ellen, is an American television talk show hosted by comedian/actress Ellen DeGeneres. Debuting on September 8, 2003, it is produced by Telepictures and airs in syndication, including stations owned by NBCUniversal. For its first five seasons, the show was taped in Studio 11 at NBC Studios in Burbank, California. It later moved to Stage 1 on the nearby Warner Bros. lot. Since the beginning of the sixth season, Ellen has broadcast in high definition. The show has won 32 Daytime Emmy Awards as of 2011. A new season of The Ellen DeGeneres Show will start on September 10, 2012(n)

programme.title: Unlocking the Great Pyramid
programme.desc: It marks one of the greatest engineering enigmas in world history: how exactly did the builders of the Great Pyramid of Giza manage to lift limestone blocks of 2.5 tons each a distance of nearly 500 feet off the ground - without the advantage of modern technology? That riddle has inspired generations of historians and researchers to comb every interior and exterior inch of the pyramid, measuring distances and amassing data to arrive at a conclusion. But only recently have more definite answers come to light - answers that originate inside of the Pyramid. The documentary program National Geographic - Unlocking the Great Pyramid discusses this arresting theory(n)

programme.title: Explorer
programme.desc: Inside North Korea. Worldly minded viewers looking to explore what life is truly like under the oppressive regime of Kim Jong Il can finally find the answers to many of their lingering questions as reporter Lisa Ling infiltrates North Korea to offer an insider's perspective on this reclusive northeast Asian country. Armed with little more than a camera, a microphone, and a pressing determination to gain a better understanding of life in and around Pyongyang, Ling poses as a medical coordinator in order to document the tireless efforts of humanitarians during her closely-guarded journey. This is the North Korea that few Americans will ever see, a vast and beautiful landscape ruled by one of the most controversial dictatorships in modern history(n)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.sub-title: Best Day Ever; The Gift of Gum
programme.desc: Best Day Ever; The Gift of Gum. Two episodes of the cartoon about an accident-prone sea sponge who works in a fast-food restaurant and has adventures with his friends Patrick Starfish, Squidward and others. SpongeBob is going to have the best day ever - but his day does not go exactly as planned. Patrick gives SpongeBob a giant ball of used gum on Best Friend's Day. SpongeBob tries to get rid of it, but fails at every attempt(n)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.sub-title: Driven to Tears; Rule of Dumb
programme.desc: Driven to Tears; Rule of Dumb. SpongeBob fails his driving test - but Patrick passes it - in 'Driven to Tears', and then in 'Rule of Dumb', it turns out that Patrick has royal heritage(n)

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Sisters in Crime. Having volunteered to babysit Steph (Jodie Sweetin) and Michelle (played by the Olsen twins) while the grownups attend a hockey game, DJ (Candace Cameron) refuses to allow her younger sisters to leave the house and attend a movie. But when her friend Steve asks her to go to the flicks herself, DJ's resolve weakens. Inevitably, the three girls convince themselves that they can return home long before Danny (Bob Saget) finds out that they've gone without permission--but the Fates are against them. Scott Weinger makes his frist series appearance, albeit as "Steve Peters" rather than Steve Hale(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Play It Again, Jesse. In urgent need of cash to support his family, Jesse (John Stamos) moonlights as a pianist at an airport cocktail lounge--only to find that he's not alone in this pursuit. Elsewhere, the consequences are severe when Steph (Jodie Sweetin)"borrows" a sweater belonging to DJ (Candace Cameron). And as Becky (Lisa Loughlin) prepares to return to "Wake Up San Francisco", Danny (Bob Saget) worries that he will never see his temporary cohost Vicky (Gail Edwards) again(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Crushed. After refusing to let Steph (Jodie Sweetin) attend a concert by her favorite singer Tommy Page, Danny secretly arranges for Tommy to sing at her 10th birthday party. So starstruck is Steph that she immediately begins imagining herself as Mrs. Tommy Page--but older sister DJ (Candace Cameron) would seem to have this honor all sewn up for herself. A sibling battle ensues, followed by a surprise revelation and an important life lesson(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Spellbound. After winning her class spelling bee, Steph (Jodie Sweetin) is entered in the school finals, only to be eliminated from the competition by a single letter. Down but not out, Steph challenges the winner, "human dictionary" Davey Chu (Jared Leong), to an intensely personal rematch. Elsewhere, Uncle Jesse (John Stamos) unexpectedly turns out to have the solution when Michelle (played by the Olsen twins) encounters difficulty learning to read(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.
programme.desc: The One with Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E. Joey (Matt LeBlanc) has a chance at landing a leading role in the science-fiction TV show "Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E." (for the record, the letters stand for Computer Humanoid Electronically Enhanced Secret Enforcer). As he prepares for his big moment, Joey's friends recall previous high points -- and moments of great professional stress -- in their own lives. Yes, it's a clip show, the second in Friends history, and the golden moments from past episodes are as funny as ever(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Meets Elizabeth's Dad
programme.desc: The One Where Ross Meets Elizabeth's Dad. Ross fails to impress his girlfriend's father. Joey gets off on the wrong foot with the operator of his robotic co-star(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Paul's the Man
programme.desc: The One Where Paul's the Man. Ross accidentally takes Elizabeth to the same cabin where Elizabeth's strict father takes Rachel for a romantic vacation. And Monica panics Chandler by planning their wedding(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with the Ring. Bruce Willis makes his third and final series appearance as Paul, the father of Ross' college-age girlfriend, Elizabeth (Alexandra Holden) -- and the current amour of Ross' former sweetie Rachel (Jennifer Aniston). As Paul's behavior becomes stranger and more ominous, Rachel begins to see her relationship with Ross (David Schwimmer) in a whole new light. Meanwhile, Chandler (Matthew Perry) enlists the aid of Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) in choosing an engagement ring for Monica (Courteney Cox)...a major mistake!(n)

Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: Six One and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international headlines.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: New series. Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.(n)

programme.title: Home of the Year
programme.desc: Home designer Hugh Wallace, architect Declan O'Donnell and interior designer Deirdre Whelan are invited to tour the homes of five famous faces, to determine which star has the most impressive home. The celebrities participating are stylist Darren Kennedy, broadcasters Norah Casey and Brent Pope, writer Terry Prone and fashion designer Helen Cody. The panellists are called to judge each dwelling for individuality, functionality and clever design. The overall winner will be named Celebrity Home of the Year, with the owner receiving a donation for a charity of their choice.(n)

programme.title: At Your Service
programme.desc: Francis Brennan comes to the aid of McCarthy's in Fethard, Co Tipperary, which operates as a pub, a restaurant and an undertakers. Vincent Murphy's family have been in the trade for five generations, but the business premises are not acceptable for any of his clients or customers - with a shoddy coffin store, a cold, dull eating area and a funeral home that hasn't been redecorated for years. Francis suggests some startling solutions to the problems.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine O'Clock and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.(n)

programme.title: Redwater
programme.desc: With Agnes pushing for the Moons to leave town, Alfie agrees that Tommy needs to get back to school - while secretly worrying about his own health. Has the time finally come to share his concerns with Kathleen? Eileen reveals her plans to transform the family farm into a cookery school, and while Roisin is appalled at the idea, Agnes is delighted her daughter has found a reason to stay. When Kieran is forced to face his fear of water, past memories come flooding back. Shane Richie, Jessie Wallace, Angeline Ball, Maria Doyle Kennedy and Fionnula Flanagan star.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Newlyweds Dermot and Maria argue over whether they should buy their own home. Meanwhile, Grandad hopes to witness his own funeral, but Mrs Brown's plans go awry when she mistakes two Mormons - who have been stealing Father Quinn's parishioners - for the men who are supposed to be delivering the coffin. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Week in Politics
programme.desc: In-depth analysis of the past seven days' developments around the country, featuring interviews and discussions with ministers, senators and TDs. With reports by Brian Dowling and Micheal Lehane.(n)

programme.title: A Thousand Words
programme.desc: A spiritual guru decides to teach his lying literary agent a lesson for his dishonesty, and places a curse on him. The spell means he can only speak another 1,000 words in his life - and when the words run out, he will die. The only way to break the enchantment is to put right all his past mistakes. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Kerry Washington.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Crime thriller following one multi-stranded inquiry over five hours. DS Steve Arnott is transferred to a police anti-corruption unit and assigned to investigate senior officer DCI Tony Gates. Not only is his target one of the most popular cops on the force, but his squad has returned the best crime figures for three consecutive years. Surely no one can be that good? Arnott soon finds himself in a cat-and-mouse struggle as he slowly unearths his superior's secrets. Lennie James, Martin Compston, Vicky McClure, Gina McKee and Neil Morrissey star.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU agents are spurred into action to prove Hotch's innocence when he is arrested on suspicion of conspiracy. The information they find, however, suggests there may be more to the case than meets the eye.(n)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Part one of two. There is little sympathy when child-killer James Wade dies in his cell, but Leo's encounter with dying ex-prison inspector Rachel Kruger compels him to investigate the notorious Redhill jail - only to come up against a wall of silence. Meanwhile, Harry meets Wade's sister Miriam and agrees to help find her brother's killer. Forensic crime drama, starring William Gaminara, Emilia Fox and Tom Ward, with Juliet Aubrey, Gillian Kearney and Jaye Griffiths.(n)

programme.title: EuroNews
programme.desc: European and international headlines live via satellite.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Goodnight Sweetheart
programme.desc: Gary returns to 1940 following an ultimatum from Yvonne, and Ron forges wartime money so his friend can make a killing on the stock exchange. Starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and Dervla Kirwan.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ash is angered by a patient's lifestyle choice, Big Mac treats an old lady who seems confused after foiling a robbery on a shop and Ethan has a breakthrough. Connie is forced to bring her daughter into work.(n)

programme.title: Funny Girl
programme.desc: Musical biopic of 1920s singer and comedienne Fanny Brice, who rose from poor beginnings in New York's slums to become an overnight star and the toast of Broadway. Her success, however, came at the price of a turbulent private life and an unhappy marriage to a gambler, who grew increasingly jealous of her fame. Starring an Oscar-winning Barbra Streisand, with Omar Sharif, Kay Medford and Walter Pidgeon.(n)

programme.title: Shortland Street
programme.desc: Long-running hospital drama set in a New Zealand accident and emergency ward, following the private and professional lives of the staff who work there.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Emma feels helpless as the police investigation ramps up, and Rhiannon comes under the spotlight. Medical drama, starring Owen Brenman and Adrian Lewis Morgan.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest stories.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo introduces James to everyone at Olivia's birthday party, but it transpires later that he took the shot of John that accompanied a disparaging feature in the day's Coastal News.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie attempts to put the pieces of his family back together, Ben is shocked to hear Elly's suspicions of Finn, and all hands are on deck to assist as Susan comes home.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the pressure builds on Jack, he gets a shock with an unexpected arrival. Mick is out to impress as the Carters prepare for a meeting with Fi, while Kim has a proposition for Denise. Patrick and Dot catch up about everything that's been happening.(n)

programme.title: Pat Shortt's Music from D'Telly
programme.desc: Variety is the order of the day as Pat Shortt discovers footage of everyone from Debbie Harry to Christy Hennessy as he reviews rarely seen performances and much-loved songs from six decades of RTÉ music television production.(n)

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers
programme.desc: Nick Park's Oscar-winning animation featuring the bumbling inventor and his faithful dog, whose lives are turned upside down after foolishly offering board and lodgings to villainous penguin Feathers McGraw. With the voice of Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Percy Jackson: Sea of Monsters
programme.desc: The modern-day teenage son of the Greek god Poseidon must lead his friends on a perilous journey into the Bermuda triangle. They need to recover the legendary Golden Fleece to save the world, but getting to it means braving all manner of terrifying monsters. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Logan Lerman and Alexandra Daddario.(n)

programme.title: Nuacht
programme.desc: The latest news headlines.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: Six One and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international headlines.(n)

programme.title: Senior Moments
programme.desc: Comedy show where the senior members of our society display their charm, warmth and wit, both out on the street pranking unsuspecting young folk and in the comfort of their own homes where they regale us with jokes, anecdotes and much more.(n)

programme.title: Reeling in the Years
programme.desc: A dip into the news and music archives for a retrospective of 1962, the year the Beatles' debut single Love Me Do was released and Sean Connery starred in the first James Bond film, Dr No. The twist was the most popular dance craze around, Dublin said farewell to the Evening Mail and in October the Cuban missile crisis brought the world to the brink of nuclear war. Includes music by Neil Sedaka, the Ronnie Drew Group, Chubby Checker, Cliff Richard and Roy Orbison.(n)

programme.title: Scannal
programme.desc: A look at the Cork hurling strikes of 2002, 2007 and 2008, when many players felt they were not getting adequate gym and medical facilities. Despite winning two All-Ireland Senior Hurling titles in 2004 and 2005, the strikes still stir up a feeling of bitterness for a lot of people.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Josh sends Lauren home when she falls ill just before an important presentation, and when Steven tries to comfort her, she finally shares some harsh words with him. Kim worries about Denise's behaviour and has a heart-to-heart with her sister, while Louise grows closer to Travis - prompting Madison and Alexandra to cast doubts in her mind about his real intentions.(n)

programme.title: Ear to the Ground
programme.desc: Featuring the Co Tipperary entrepreneurial farmer building up an impressive herd of rare breed Dexters and a Leitrim native who has been driving a horse carriage on the streets of New York for over 30 years. Plus, the McCann family from Co Mayo talk about their thriving enterprise making cookies and the importance of keeping jobs in rural Ireland.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine O'Clock and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.(n)

programme.title: Life's a Breeze
programme.desc: An elderly woman tells her children she had stored her life savings in her mattress, which they had just had removed while giving their mother's house a thorough clean-out without her knowledge. The family then take to the streets of Dublin in search of the item and the fortune it contains. Comedy written and directed by Lance Daly, starring Kelly Thornton, Fionnula Flanagan, Pat Shortt and Eva Birthistle.(n)

programme.title: In Plain Sight
programme.desc: The day after Isabelle Cooke disappears, Manuel hands himself in to Muncie with an alibi for his movements of the previous 24 hours, leaving him free once again. Four days later Peter and Doris Smart and their 12-year-old son are shot dead in their beds. The killer takes care to dispose of their bodies and the gun used to do the deed, but also pockets 15 one-pound notes found in Peter Smart's wallet. On discovering that the previously flat-broke Manuel had been generously buying rounds of drinks on New Year's Day, Muncie begins to put the pieces of the puzzle together, and begins to close in on the Beast of Birkenshaw. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: International Rescue are dispatched to save one of their own when the Hood traps Lady Penelope and Parker inside an underwater hyper-train loop during a high-stakes robbery. Updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, with the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak, Thomas Brodie-Sangster and David Graham.(n)

programme.title: Mr Young
programme.desc: Comedy about a child genius who returns to high school as a teacher while still in his teens.(n)

programme.desc: Casey's selfish game plan becomes very clear, whille Noah has to make a big decision.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Murray seems keen when Adam announces he wants to take up a new activity at school - until he discovers it is fencing. Beverly tries her hand at matchmaking. Ana Gasteyer (Suburgatory) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Hoping that Pops' good luck can rub off on him, Adam takes to gambling at school - but ends up losing his toys. Erica wants to take part in a popular TV dance show, but when she gets the chance her dream quickly turns into a nightmare.(n)

programme.title: The Sunday Game Live
programme.desc: Down v Armagh (Throw-in 2.00pm). Michael Lyster presents coverage of the Ulster Senior Football Championship quarter-final at Pairc Esler in Newry. Both sides were defeated at this stage of last season's competition, with Down losing to Monaghan and Armagh falling short against Cavan. Commentary by Ger Canning and Martin Carney.(n)

programme.desc: The truth about the Black Fairy and her past relationship with Rumple is revealed.(n)

programme.desc: Ross encourages Chandler and Monica to move in together and makes a dramatic decision about Rachel. David Schwimmer, Matthew Perry, Courteney Cox and Jennifer Aniston star.(n)

programme.desc: The friends try to solve the mystery of Sheldon's post-lunch activities, following him to a secret room where they discover how he chills out. Elsewhere, Leonard is jealous when Penny starts texting a classmate, but things quickly change when Alex gets flirty with him.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Another helping of four-wheel features, including test drives and reports on the latest models, plus a celebrity taking to the show's test track in Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: One Love Manchester Concert
programme.desc: Live coverage of the benefit concert from Old Trafford cricket ground in Manchester, organised to raise money for those affected by last month's Manchester bombing. The stellar line-up includes Ariana Grande, Take That, Katy Perry, Justin Bieber, Coldplay, Pharrell and Usher, with proceeds going to the We Love Manchester emergency fund.(n)

programme.desc: Des Cahill introduces highlights of the weekend's provincial GAA games, including Down v Armagh and Dublin v Carlow in football, and Limerick v Clare in hurling.(n)

programme.desc: Republic of Ireland v Uruguay. Darragh Maloney presents action from the friendly encounter, which took place at the Aviva Stadium. With analysis by Kenny Cunningham and Richie Sadlier, and commentary from George Hamilton and Jim Beglin.(n)

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls
programme.desc: New series. Reality show in which 13 British men are left on a remote, uninhabited Pacific island for a month. Adventurer Bear Grylls finds out whether the volunteers - filming themselves and stripped of all the luxuries of 21st-century living - can use teamwork to survive tough conditions with only some basic tools and the clothes they're wearing. In the first edition, tempers fray and doubts set in as the men seek shelter for the night, and with dehydration and hunger taking hold, they urgently need to find water and make a fire.(n)

programme.title: Alan Carr: Chatty Man
programme.desc: The funnyman is joined by IT Crowd and Moone Boy actor Chris O'Dowd, who talks about his film The Sapphires, and boy band sensations JLS, chatting and performing their single Hottest Girl in the World.(n)

programme.title: Gotham
programme.desc: Gordon and Bullock investigate a murder at Leslie and Mario's engagement party, Ivy leads Bruce and Selina into trouble, and Nygma needs Penguin's help.(n)

programme.title: Elementary

He acquires a group of new friends on his journey, who help each other to avoid predators and obstacles in their way. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Gabriel Damon and Pat Hingle.(n)

programme.title: Greystoke: The Legend of Tarzan, Lord of the Apes
programme.desc: The infant heir of an aristocratic English family is raised by apes in the African jungle after his shipwrecked parents are killed. Years later, he saves the life of a Belgian explorer, who returns him to England so he can claim his birthright. Drama based on Edgar Rice Burroughs' novel, starring Christopher Lambert, Ian Holm, Andie MacDowell and Ralph Richardson.(n)

programme.sub-title: Deadly Pole to Pole: The Complete Journey: Deadly Dinosaurs.

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: After four weeks of competition, the 12 remaining contenders come together to compete in the semi-finals. They face an Invention test that features an abundant selection of meat, fish, fruit, vegetables and herbs and spices to choose from, but must go back to basics as all the modern machines are removed from the kitchen. Marcus Wareing, Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace then choose the best eight to go straight through, leaving the four weakest to cook off for the two remaining places in the competition.(n)

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: New series. Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar return as detectives Cassie and Sunny, who find themselves thrown into another historic murder case with the discover of a body. This time it's the perfectly preserved remains of a middle-aged man found in a suitcase in the silt of a London river. As the detectives begin the complicated task of trying to identify the victim, four unconnected people go about their business - Brighton-based lawyer Colin Osborne, paediatric nurse Marion Kelsey, teacher Sara Mahmoud and respected police officer Tessa Nixon - unaware they are about to be dragged into the investigation. Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar star, with Mark Bonnar, Lorraine Ashbourne, Charlie Condou and Wendy Craig.(n)

programme.desc: When Yeardley falls seriously ill and Farlow seizes power, Redwick spies a chance to overturn the governing elite and engineers a mutiny in which Verity finds herself playing a key part. Meanwhile, when Alice accuses James Read of being involved in the death of her cow, she unwittingly sends him on vengeful quest to determine what really happened to Silas's brother Henry, while Jocelyn realises she may have underestimated Temperance.(n)

programme.title: The Blacklist

Grant tries to intercept the threat by sending Scott undercover to the meeting point, but an encounter with an attractive woman compromises the mission.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Pat Seddon considers selling up and visits a clairvoyant, while celebrity chef Mitch Tonks makes an appearance at Brixham's Crab Festival.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Maritime Inn landlady Pat gets her first full house of the season as Brixham's tourist trade picks up for the summer - but refuses to hire anyone to help her with the extra work. Powerboat instructor Mike Weatherbee tries to enforce the laws of the sea, carpet-cleaner Dave Satchwill prepares to lead the town's popular ghost tour, and lone fisherman Dave Brown reveals his unusual methods.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: August arrives and the fishermen of Brixham spend time ashore with their families as their boats are repaired - but summer proves costly for Jan, who loses £1,000 for every day his vessel is out of action. Apprentice deckhand Logan has to decide whether a life at sea is the right choice for him and his family, and seafood seller Jenny receives a surprise on her 65th birthday.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The clinic is overwhelmed by a meningitis epidemic, but House is drawn to a 12-year-old whose symptoms do not quite match those of the other patients. His fellow doctors believe he is trying to get out of treating the vast number of other possible cases - though they change their tune once the test results return. Hugh Laurie stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The medic admits a 21-year-old patient suffering from a stroke, and when the problem recurs, the team is puzzled as to the cause. The case is compounded when the man's parents refuse to consent to him having surgery. Meanwhile, the doctors are curious to know why House agreed to go out with Cameron. Medical drama, with Hugh Laurie and guest star Peter Graves (Mission: Impossible).(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny is interrogated by the District Attorney's investigator when his ex-partner is accused of planting evidence in order to wrap up a homicide case. Meanwhile, Frank grapples with the limits of free speech. Starring Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank's first partner announces plans to publish a book filled with stories of their early days on the force, prompting the police commissioner to worry his personal secrets might be about to be made public. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A mobster is found shot in his car, with his low-level errand boy tied up in the trunk. Meanwhile, an NYPD officer asks for a new shield number - the same one as Frank's deceased son Joe. Crime drama starring Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When a retired cop is accused of shooting his mugger, Frank must deal with the aftermath. Meanwhile, a man who killed Baez's friend 25 years ago returns, leaving her and Danny to figure out how to bring him to justice.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny is in an unusual situation when multiple women take credit for the murder of their boss, while Frank disagrees with a priest about how to handle a local boy who has been stealing money from the church. Elsewhere, Nicky is arrested with a group of her friends when the police find drugs stashed in her car.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Linda asks Danny and Baez to help her co-worker, who is having trouble with her ex-husband, while Erin must work out how to handle her former mentor. programme.title: Nurse Jackie

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming discovers more little-known facts on a journey between Smithfields and Spitalfields, two of London's most famous markets. He begins with a fry-up breakfast before visiting the remains of a Roman amphitheatre and investigating a mysterious secret in a Liverpool Street hotel, as well as meeting former EastEnders star Larry Lamb (Archie Mitchell).(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat investigates the balance of power in Rome and discovers how the city has been affected by the end of Silvio Berlusconi's government. He also explores the influence of organised crime in the Italian capital and speaks to journalist Myrta Merlino, fashion designer and politician Santo Versace and Pietro Grasso, the head of the city's anti-Mafia crime unit.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat visits Los Angeles to investigate how America's entertainment industry is faring in the 21st century, and meets Ron Meyer, president of Universal Studios. He also explores the city's vast social and economic divides, and discovers how homelessness and gang culture affect its residents.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Fitzalan Howard, the owners of Carlton Towers near Selby in North Yorkshire, prepare to host a fitness boot camp weekend at their property - while also welcoming an array of guests to celebrate their son's birthday. Meanwhile, Sir Benjamin Slade hopes a murder mystery weekend at Maunsel House in Somerset will help pay off a sizeable electricity bill.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The remains of a four-year-old girl are found at the bottom of the river, where they have apparently lain since 1965. In trying to discover her identity, Rush and the team learn she came from an abusive home - and that someone was trying to save her. Meanwhile, Stillman offers Kat Miller a job in Homicide.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The grumpy doctor examines a man with Aids who has been stalking him, but struggles to pinpoint why his condition has worsened. programme.desc: The actor discovers some of the hidden extras on offer in the world's most expensive hotels. At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)

programme.desc: Stand-alone episode of the political drama, specially penned by creator Aaron Sorkin in response to the attacks on America on September 11. Students visiting the White House are caught up in a security alert involving suspected Islamic extremists.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Part one of two. CJ makes a crucial gaffe during a press conference and the president has to decide whether to send in the military to rescue the staff of a besieged US embassy.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
